AppraisalAvailabilityOfDocument.description: Indicates if the Appraisal is available. If it is available, TRUE; if it is not available, FALSE.

AppraisalAvailabilityOfDocumentException.description: Indicates if there are exceptions to the Appraisal or issues raised. If there are exceptions, TRUE; if there are no exceptions, FALSE.

AppraisalAvailabilityOfFinalDocument.description: Indicates if the Appraisal is available in final form. If it is available in final form, TRUE; if it is only available in draft form, FALSE.

AppraisalCostApproach.description: Indicates if the appraisal considers the cost approach. If it does, TRUE; if it does not, FALSE.

AppraisalCounterparties.description: Names of counterparties to the Appraisal.

AppraisalEnteredDate.description: Date on which appraisal was entered / corrected.

AppraisalExceptionDescription.description: Description of any exceptions to the Appraisal or issues raised.

AppraisalIncomeApproach.description: Indicates if the appraisal considers the income approach. If it does, TRUE; if it does not, FALSE.

AppraisalInputDevelopmentFee.description: Amount of the development fee as an input to the appraisal.

AppraisalInputEngineeringProcurementandC.description: Amount of the Engineering Procurement and Construction fee, as an input to the appraisal.

AppraisalInputInvestmentTaxCreditBasisFo.description: The Investment Tax Credit-eligible basis for the plant.

AppraisalInputInvestmentTaxCreditForStor.description: The Investment Tax Credit-eligible amount for the storage component.

AppraisalInputInvestmentTaxCreditforSyst.description: The Investment Tax Credit-eligible amount for the plant.

AppraisalInputStorageUsefulLife.description: Useful life of storage system in years, as input to the appraisal.

AppraisalInputWeightedAverageCostofCapit.description: Weighted average cost of capital under income approach as an input to the appraisal.

AppraisalMarketComparison.description: Indicates if the appraisal considers market comparables. If it does, TRUE; if it does not, FALSE.

AppraisalMethod.description: Description of the methodology for the appraisal, for example, average, lower of, or higher of.

AppraisalSource.description: Description of the source of the appraisal, for example, sponsor, internal or appraiser.

AppraisalStage.description: Identifies the stage of the appraisal, for example, closing, initial funding, final funding.

AppraisalStatus.description: Identifies the status of the appraisal, for example, preliminary, indicative or final.

AppraisalIdentifier.description: Identifier for an appraisal performed on a site.

AppraisalVersion.description: Description of the version of the appraisal.

AppraisedValueFairMarketValue.description: Total appraised value for the system at fair market value.

AppraisedValueStorageComponent.description: Appraised value for the storage component.

AppraisedValueSystemCostMethod.description: Appraised value for the total system based on the cost method.

AppraisedValueSystemIncomeMethod.description: Appraised value for the total system based on the income method.

AppraisedValueSystemMarketCompMethod.description: Appraised value for the total system based on the market comparable method.

AppraisedValuetoAppraisedValueAtCommerci.description: Appraised value as % of appraised value at commercial operations date.

AppraisedValueValuationPoint.description: Point in time for which value is appraised, for example, at commercial operations date, at flip point, at PPA expiration.

ApprovalConditionActionDescription.description: Description of actions taken in response to the approval condition.

ApprovalConditionDescription.description: Description of the approval condition and possible follow up.

ApprovalConditionStatus.description: Status of the approval condition or follow up request, for example open or closed.

ApprovalMemoSubmissionDate.description: Date on which the approval memo was submitted.

ApprovalNoticeAvailabilityOfDocument.description: Indicates if the Approval Notice is available. If it is available, TRUE; if it is not available, FALSE.

ApprovalNoticeDocumentLink.description: Link to the Approval Notice document.

ApprovalNoticeEffectiveDate.description: Effective date of the Approval Notice.

ApprovalNoticeExpirationDate.description: Expiration date of the Approval Notice.

ApprovalsAvailabilityofProof.description: Indication that proof of approval is available. If proof of approval is available, TRUE; if not, FALSE.

ApprovalsDateofApproval.description: Date on which final approval was obtained.

ApprovalsGrantingEmployee.description: Identifier for the employee granting approval.

ApprovalsProofLink.description: Link to the proof of approval.

ArrayNumberOfSubArrays.description: Number of sub arrays which are PV surface unit connected to an inverter.

For example, a 5-year term would be represented as P5Y, a 3-month term as P3M, and a 4-year, 6-month and 10-day term would be represented as P4Y6M10D.

AssetManagementCosts.description: The aggregate costs related to asset management during the reporting period.

AssetManagerNumberOfProjects.description: Number of projects under management by the asset manager.

AssetManagerNumberOfStates.description: Number of states where Asset manager operates.

AssetManagerOperationalCenter.description: Description of the operational center managed by the asset manager.

AssetManagerOtherServices.description: Description of the  other service offerings available from the asset manager.

AssetManagerOutsourcingPlan.description: Description of operational areas that will be outsourced along with qualifications of the companies the asset manager will engage.

AssetManagerPerformanceGuarantees.description: Description of the asset manager performance guarantees.

AssetManagerPreventativeAndCorrectiveMai.description: Description of the preventative and corrective maintenance plan and use of major maintenance budgets and reserve account by the asset manager.

AssetManagerProjectsOwnedToThirdPartyPro.description: Ratio of projects owned by the asset manager versus projected owned by third parties.

AssetManagerRenewableEnergyCreditAccount.description: Description of the asset manager plans for renewable energy credit (REC) accounting, for example through WREGIS, renewable energy registry and tracking.

AssetManagerReporting.description: Description of the asset manager reporting plan, for example monthly operating reports, establishing a reporting portal.

AssetManagerSparePartsStrategy.description: Description of the asset manager's strategy to manage spare parts.

AssetManagerConsumablesStrategy.description: Description of the asset manager's strategy to manage consumable parts, which are items such as fuses that are used up quickly and must be replenished.

AssetManagerSupplyStrategy.description: Description of the asset manager supply strategy.

AssetManagerWarrantyExperience.description: Description of the asset manager warranty claims experience and warranty work management.

AssetManagerWorkflow.description: Description of the asset manager workflow process and ticketing system.

AssignmentAndAssumptionAgreementExpirati.description: Expiration date of the Assignment and Assumption Agreement.

AssumedIrradiationModelAmount.description: Assumed plane of array (POA) irradiation per annum based on major design/energy production model used.

AuditFees.description: Amount of audit fees incurred during the period.

AuthorityHavingJurisdictionIdentifier.description: Municipal authority, for example, town, city or country, that has jurisdiction to define local code requirements.

AvailabilityCalculationMethod.description: Description of method used to calculate availability, which could be IECRE 61724-3 or some other method.

BackupAssetManagementContractCounterpart.description: Name of  backup asset management company.

BackupAssetManagementContractTerm.description: Term of the Backup Asset Management Contract. The value should be entered using the ISO8601 format of PnYnMnDTnHnMnS. For example, a 5-year term would be represented as P5Y, a 3-month term as P3M, and a 4-year, 6-month and 10-day term would be represented as P4Y6M10D.

BackupAssetManagementExpirationDate.description: Expiration date of the backup asset management agreement.

BackupAssetManagementFeePriorToActivatio.description: Amount paid prior to activation of the backup asset management program.

BackupAssetManagementInitiationDate.description: Initiation date of the backup asset management contract.

BackupAssetManagementMobilizationFee.description: Mobilization fee for backup Operations and Maintenance contract.

BackupAssetManagementMonthlyFee.description: Monthly fees for duration of the backup asset management program.

BackupOperationsAndMaintenanceContractCo.description: Name of backup Operations and Maintenance contract counterparty.

BackupOperationsAndMaintenanceContractIn.description: Initiation date for backup Operations and Maintenance contract.

BackupOperationsAndMaintenanceContractTe.description: Term of Backup Operations and Maintenance contract. The value should be entered using the ISO8601 format of PnYnMnDTnHnMnS. For example, a 5-year term would be represented as P5Y, a 3-month term as P3M, and a 4-year, 6-month and 10-day term would be represented as P4Y6M10D.

BackUpOperationsAndMaintenanceMonthlyFee.description: Monthly fees for backup Operations and Maintenance Contract.

BackupOperationsAndMaintenanceUpfrontMob.description: Mobilization fee for backup Operations and Maintenance contract per the Continuity of Operations Agreement which is the plan for the installation going forward including contingencies which may be triggered by financial performance.

BankAccountTypeDescription.description: Description of the type of bank account, for example, operating, lockbox, reserve, accrual.

BankInvestment.description: Size of the banks investment in the entity.

BankName.description: Bank at which account is held.

BankRoutingNumber.description: Routing number for the bank account.

BatteryManagementSystemNumberOfSystems.description: Total number of battery management systems in the plant (system).

BatteryManagementSystemRating.description: Maximum power output, under standard test conditions, of the battery management system.

BatteryNumber.description: Total number of batteries in the system.

BatteryRating.description: Maximum power output, under standard test conditions, of the battery, per IEC62933-1.

BatteryInverterNumber.description: Total number of battery inverters in the system.

BatteryInverterACPowerRating.description: Maximum power output, in AC, of the inverter model, IEC62933-1

BatteryStyle.description: Battery chemistry style which can be LiOn, Pb, or NiCad.

Number of months that the project working capital account is prefunded at the start of the project.

CombinerBoxTemperatureMaximum.description: Maximum operating temperature of the combiner box, the mechanism that brings together multiple solar strings. This is used in a product specification to indicate the operating temperature of the combiner box. Can be reported as Celsius or Fahrenheit by the preparer when specifying units in the instance document.

CombinerBoxTemperatureMinimum.description: Minimum operating temperature of the combiner box, the mechanism that brings together multiple solar strings. This is used in a product specification to indicate the operating temperature of the combiner box.  Can be reported as Celsius or Fahrenheit by the preparer when specifying units in the instance document.

CombinerRating.description: Maximum power output, in kWdc, of the combiner model.

CommentsForPowerTargetCapMeasurement.description: Additional comments needed to explain the targeted conditions for the capacity measurement using IEC 61724-2.

ComponentFailure.description: Indication of component failure. If component has failed, TRUE. If component has not failed, FALSE.

ComponentMaintenanceCostAssociatedTimePe.description: Time period on which the component maintenance cost is based. The value should be entered using the ISO8601 format of PnYnMnDTnHnMnS. For example, a 5-year term would be represented as P5Y, a 3-month term as P3M, and a 4-year, 6-month and 10-day term would be represented as P4Y6M10D.

ComponentMaintenanceStatusPercentRemaini.description: Percent remaining to be completed on maintenance of component.

ComponentToBeReplaced.description: Component that needs to be replaced.

ComponentToBeRepaired.description: Name of component that requires repair.

ComponentMaintenanceCostTimePeriod.description: Duration of the time period associated with the component maintenance cost. The value should be entered using the ISO8601 format of PnYnMnDTnHnMnS. For example, a 5-year term would be represented as P5Y, a 3-month term as P3M, and a 4-year, 6-month and 10-day term would be represented as P4Y6M10D.

ComponentMaintenanceCostForEquipmentWith.description: Maintenance cost amount for equipment that has no warranty.
Maintenance cost amount for equipment that has a warranty.

ComponentMaintenanceSeverityOfEvent.description: Level of severity of the maintenance event, which can be Low, Moderate, or High.

ProjectRecentEventSeverityOfEvent.description: Level of severity of the recent project event, which can be Low, Moderate, or High.

ComponentMaintenanceAction.description: Description of the action taken which can be to repair or replace the component.

ReasonForComponentMaintenanceTicket.description: Reason for the maintenance ticket written regarding a component related to the system.

SubReasonForComponentMaintenanceTicket.description: Reason that the maintenance ticket concerning a component related to the system requires a continuation.

ComponentMaintenanceNumberOfComponentsAf.description: Number of components affected by the maintenance requirements.

ComponentMaintenanceTicketComments.description: Comments written about the maintenance ticket.

OperationsAndMaintenanceProviderCaseIden.description: Case identifier for the operations and maintenance provider.

ComponentMaintenanceTicketDateOpen.description: Date when the maintenance ticket was opened.

ComponentMaintenanceTicketDateClosed.description: Date when the maintenance ticket was closed.

CreditPerformanceRetailCreditCheckDate.description: Date the credit check was performed.

CreditPerformanceRetailDaysDelinquent.description: Number of days over 30 days past due (delinquent).

CreditPerformanceRetailDebtToIncomeRatio.description: Debt-to-income ratio, also known as Back End Ratio which is defined as the ratio of a borrower's total monthly debt expense (including mortgage payments, credit card payments, child support, and other loan payments) divided by the borrower's gross monthly income. The ratio is expressed as a percentage of the gross monthly income. Use GSE calculation.

CreditPerformanceRetailFICOMethod.description: Credit evaluation model used for the most recently obtained FICO score.

CreditPerformanceRetailFICOModelOriginat.description: Indicates whether the FICO score was calculated using the Classic or Next Generation model.

CreditPerformanceRetailFICOScore.description: Numeric credit score for borrower (or co-borrower) resulting from credit evaluation model specified.

CreditPerformanceRetailHomeAppraisalDate.description: Date of the appraisal of the home.

CreditPerformanceRetailLengthOfEmploymen.description: The length of service to an employer from the start of employment until the date of the loan.

CreditPerformanceRetailLengthOfHomeOwner.description: The length of time that the home has been owned.

CreditPerformanceRetailLoanToValueRatio.description: In the case of a purchase mortgage loan, the ratio obtained by dividing the original mortgage loan amount on the note date by the lesser of the mortgaged property appraised value on the note date or its purchase price. In the case of a refinance mortgage loan, the ratio obtained by dividing the original mortgage loan amount on the note date and the mortgaged property appraised value on the note date. In the case of a seasoned mortgage loan, if the Seller cannot warrant that the value of the mortgaged property has not declined since the note date, Freddie Mac requires that the Seller must provide a new appraisal value, which is used in the LTV calculation. Percentages below 6% or greater than 105% will be disclosed as 'Unknown,' indicated by a blank space. In the case of an FHA/VA mortgage loan, percentages less than 6% or greater than 110% will be disclosed as 'Unknown,' which will be indicated by a blank space.

CreditPerformanceRetailLoantoValueSource.description: Source of Loan to Value ratio if not calculated.

CreditPerformanceRetailMortgageBalance.description: Amount of the balance on the mortgage.

CreditPerformanceRetailW2VerificationofE.description: Indication whether employment has been verified throught the employees W2; if it has been verified, TRUE; if it has not been verified, FALSE.

CreditSupportAmountEndDate.description: End date for the period of the credit support amount.

CreditSupportAmountNumberOfPeriod.description: Number of the period for the credit support amount, for example, period 1.

CreditSupportAmountPeriodAmount.description: Amount of credit support during the period.

CreditSupportAmountStartDate.description: Start date for the period of the credit support amount.

CreditSupportBeneficiaryCounterpartyIden.description: Identifier for the beneficiary which is a Counterparty.

CreditSupportBeneficiarySPVIdentifier.description: Identifier for the beneficiary which is an SPV.

CreditSupportBeneficiaryType.description: Indicates if the beneficiary is an SPV or a counterparty.

CreditSupportComment.description: Additional comments about the credit support.

CreditSupportEndDate.description: Date on which credit support should end

CreditSupportForAssetManagementAgreement.description: Indicates if credit support is for the Asset Management Agreement. If it is, TRUE; if it is not, FALSE.

CreditSupportForEngineeringProcurementan.description: Indicates if credit support is for the Engineering Procurement and Construction Agreement. If it is, TRUE; if it is not, FALSE.

CreditSupportForEquityCapitalContributio.description: Indicates if credit support is for the Equity Capital Contribution Agreement. If it is, TRUE; if it is not, FALSE.

CreditSupportForHedgeAgreement.description: Indicates if credit support is for the Hedge Agreement. If it is, TRUE; if it is not, FALSE.

CreditSupportForIndividualContractorAgre.description: Indicates if credit support is for the Interconnection Agreement. If it is, TRUE; if it is not, FALSE.

CreditSupportForLeaseSchedule.description: Indicates if credit support is for the Lease Schedule. If it is, TRUE; if it is not, FALSE.

CreditSupportForLimitedLiabilityCompanyA.description: Indicates if credit support is for the Limited Liability Company Agreement. If it is, TRUE; if it is not, FALSE.

CreditSupportForMasterLeaseAgreement.description: Indicates if credit support is for the Master Lease Agreement. If it is, TRUE; if it is not, FALSE.

CreditSupportForOperationsandMaintenance.description: Indicates if credit support is for the Operations and Maintenance Agreement. If it is, TRUE; if it is not, FALSE.

CreditSupportForPowerPurchaseAgreement.description: Indicates if credit support is for the Power Purchase Agreement. If it is, TRUE; if it is not, FALSE.

CreditSupportForSiteLeaseAgreement.description: Indicates if credit support is for the Site Lease Agreement. If it is, TRUE; if it is not, FALSE.

CreditSupportForSitePermit.description: Indicates if credit support is for the Site Permit Agreement. If it is, TRUE; if it is not, FALSE.

CreditSupportForTermLoanAgreement.description: Indicates if credit support is for the Term Loan Agreement. If it is, TRUE; if it is not, FALSE.

CreditSupportIssuingEntityName.description: Name of bank or surety issuing support.

CreditSupportObligorCounterpartyIdentifi.description: Identifier for the obligor which is a counterparty.

CreditSupportObligorSPVIdentifier.description: Identifier for the obligor which is an SPV.

CreditSupportObligorType.description: Indicates if the obligor is an SPV or a counterparty.

CreditSupportProvider.description: Name of individual or organization providing the Credit Support.

CreditSupportReceiver.description: Name of individual or organization receiving the Credit Support.

CreditSupportStartDate.description: Date on which credit support should start.

CreditSupportStatus.description: Status of credit support, which can be Not Due, Overdue, Granted or Expired.

CreditSupportTerm.description: Duration of the credit support term. The value should be entered using the ISO8601 format of PnYnMnDTnHnMnS. For example, a 5-year term would be represented as P5Y, a 3-month term as P3M, and a 4-year, 6-month and 10-day term would be represented as P4Y6M10D.

CreditSupportType.description: Type of Credit Support, for example, Standby LC, Parent Guaranty, Surety Bond, Cash.

CrossDefaultPoolBothPartiesCross.description: Indicates if both parties can cross the default. If both can, TRUE; if not, FALSE.

CrossDefaultPoolForAssetManagementAgreem.description: Indicates if there is a cross default pool for the Asset Management Agreement. If it is, TRUE; if it is not, FALSE.

CrossDefaultPoolForEngineeringProcuremen.description: Indicates if there is a cross default pool for the Engineering Procurement and Construction Agreement. If it is, TRUE; if it is not, FALSE.

CrossDefaultPoolForEquityCapitalContribu.description: Indicates if there is a cross default pool for the Equity Capital Contribution Agreement. If it is, TRUE; if it is not, FALSE.

CrossDefaultPoolForHedgeAgreement.description: Indicates if there is a cross default pool for the Hedge Agreement. If it is, TRUE; if it is not, FALSE.

CrossDefaultPoolForIndividualContractorA.description: Indicates if there is a cross default pool for the Individual Contractor Agreement. If it is, TRUE; if it is not, FALSE.

CrossDefaultPoolForLeaseSchedule.description: Indicates if there is a cross default pool for the Lease Schedule. If it is, TRUE; if it is not, FALSE.

CrossDefaultPoolForLimitedLiabilityCompa.description: Indicates if there is a cross default pool for the Limited Liability Company Agreement. If it is, TRUE; if it is not, FALSE.

CrossDefaultPoolForMasterLeaseAgreement.description: Indicates if there is a cross default pool for the Master Lease Agreement. If it is, TRUE; if it is not, FALSE.

CrossDefaultPoolForOperationsandMaintena.description: Indicates if there is a cross default pool for the Operations and Maintenance Agreement. If it is, TRUE; if it is not, FALSE.

CrossDefaultPoolForPowerPurchaseAgreemen.description: Indicates if there is a cross default pool for the Power Purchase Agreement. If it is, TRUE; if it is not, FALSE.

CrossDefaultPoolForSiteLeaseAgreement.description: Indicates if there is a cross default pool for the Site Lease Agreement. If it is, TRUE; if it is not, FALSE.

CrossDefaultPoolForSitePermit.description: Indicates if there is a cross default pool for the Site Permit Agreement. If it is, TRUE; if it is not, FALSE.

CrossDefaultPoolForTermLoanAgreement.description: Indicates if there is a cross default pool for the Term Loan Agreement. If it is, TRUE; if it is not, FALSE.

CrossDefaultPoolMonetizingofCollateral.description: Indication if, in the event of a default, the non breaching party can monetize the collateral on the other agreement.

CrossDefaultPoolPartyAbleToDefaultDescri.description: Description of the party that is able to declare default.

CulturalResourceIdentified.description: Description of the cultural resource item identified.

CulturalResourceIdentifiedLocation.description: Description of the location of the cultural resource.

CulturalResourceIdentifiedName.description: Name of the cultural resource item identified.

CulturalResourcePermitActionDescription.description: Description of action required by the cultural resources permit, for example, a fee or covenant.

CulturalResourcePermitGoverningAuthority.description: Name of the governing authority that issued the permit for the cultural resource.

CulturalResourcePermitIdentifier.description: Identifier for the cultural resource permit to which an identified action belongs.

CulturalResourcePermitIssueDate.description: Date on which the cultural resource permit was issued.

CulturalResourcePermitLink.description: Link to the cultural resource permit.

CulturalResourceStudyIdentifierName.description: Name of the cultural resource study.

CulturalResourceStudyLink.description: Link to the cultural resource report.

CulturalResourceStudyPreparer.description: Name of the consultant who prepared the cultural resource study.

CurtailmentMeasurementPeriod.description: Time period over which curtailment is measured.

Curtailment.description: Amount of curtailment in kWh which is a reduction in the energy output of a generator from what it could otherwise produce given available resources (e.g., wind or sunlight).

CutSheetDocumentLink.description: URI to the location of the Cut Sheet (Data Sheet)  published by the  manufacturer.

DataAcquisitionSystemCommunicationProtoc.description: Communication protocol of the Data Acquisition System which can be Modbus, Zigbee, WIFI, or Ethernet.

DataAcquisitionSystemLicenseExpirationDa.description: Expiration date of the Data Acquisition System license.

DataAcquisitionSystemDocumentationLink.description: Link to the documentation URI for the Data Acquisition System.

DataAcquisitionSystemIPAddress.description: IP address for the Data Acquisition System.

DataAcquisitionSystemLicenseExpense.description: Cost of the Data Acquisition System license.

DataAcquisitionSystemManufacturerContact.description: Name and title of contact for Data Acquisition System.

DataAcquisitionSystemManufacturerEmailAd.description: Email address for Data Acquisition System.

DataAcquisitionSystemManufacturerName.description: Name of Data Acquisition System manufacturer.

DataAcquisitionSystemModelNumber.description: Model number of Data Acquisition System.

DataAcquisitionSystemNumberOfUnits.description: Number of Data Acquisition Systems in a portfolio.

SCADASystemCommunicationProtocol.description: Communication protocol of the SCADA System which can be Modbus, Zigbee, WIFI, or Ethernet.

SCADASystemLicenseExpirationDate.description: Expiration date of the SCADA (Supervisory Control & Data Acquisition) system license.

SCADASystemDocumentationLink.description: Link to the documentation URI for the SCADA System.

SCADASystemIPAddress.description: IP address for the SCADA (Supervisory Control & Data Acquisition) system.

SCADASystemLicenseExpense.description: Cost of the SCADA (Supervisory Control & Data Acquisition) license.

SCADASystemManufacturerContactAndTitle.description: Name and title of contact for SCADA (Supervisory Control & Data Acquisition) system.

SCADASystemManufacturerEmailAddress.description: Email address for SCADA (Supervisory Control & Data Acquisition) system.

SCADASystemManufacturerName.description: Name of SCADA (Supervisory Control & Data Acquisition) systems manufacturer.

SCADASystemModelNumber.description: Model number of SCADA (Supervisory Control & Data Acquisition) system.

SCADASystemNumberOfUnits.description: Number of SCADA (Supervisory Control & Data Acquisition) systems in a portfolio.

DCPowerDesign.description: DC Nameplate capacity which is the sum of module ratings at standard test conditions as defined in the design.

DebtInstrumentPeriodicPaymentInterest.description: Amount of the required periodic payments applied to interest.

DebtInstrumentPeriodicPaymentPrincipal.description: Amount of the required periodic payments applied to principal.

DeficitRestorationObligation.description: An amount contributed by a partner with a negative capital account balance that brings the account balance to zero when the partnership interest is liquidated, usually within 90 days or by the end of the tax year in which the partner's interest are sold.

DeficitRestorationObligationLimit.description: Amount of the cap on the deficit restoration obligation.

DesignAndConstructionDocumentLink.description: Link to the Design And Construction document.

DesignAndConstructionDocumentsAvailabili.description: Indicates if the Design and Construction Documents is available. If it is available, TRUE; if it is not available, FALSE.
Indicates if there are exceptions to the Design and Construction Documents or issues raised. If there are exceptions, TRUE; if there are no exceptions, FALSE.
Indicates if the Design and Construction Documents is available in final form. If it is available in fnal form, TRUE; if it is only available in draft form, FALSE.

DesignAndConstructionDocumentsCounterpar.description: Names of counterparties to the Design and Construction Documents.

DesignAndConstructionDocumentsExceptionD.description: Description of any exceptions to the Design and Construction Documents or issues raised.

DesignAttributePVACCapacity.description: Total AC Capacity of the system based on the design of the system and the manufacturer's expected capacity (calculated as DC X (1-derate factor)).

DesignAttributePVACRating.description: Nominal AC power rating of the System based on the design of the system  in kWp.

DesignAttributePVDCCapacity.description: Total DC Capacity of the system based on the design of the system at Standard Test Conditions.

DeveloperCommunityEngagement.description: Description of developer's engagement with the local community on current and past projects.

DeveloperConstructionDevelopmentExperien.description: Description of the developers past experience with project development and construction.

DeveloperConstructionNumberOfMegawatts.description: Number of megawatts (MWac) developer has constructed.

DeveloperCurrentFunds.description: Description of funds the developer is involved with including general fund structure, organization and competitive advantage in target markets.

DeveloperEngineeringProcurementAndConstr.description: Description of the aspects of EPC (Engineering Procurement and Construction) performed by the developer as a prime contractor.
Description of developer's EPC (Engineering Procurement and Construction) warranty strategy.

DeveloperExecutiveBios.description: Executive biographies of the developer company management.

DeveloperFundingTechnologyExperience.description: Description of developer experience with technology contemplated for funding, customers, amount of megawatts developed in US and abroad, time in business in US and abroad.

DeveloperFundReports.description: Description of fund prospectus' and other reports provided to investors for the current fund.

DeveloperGovernanceDecisionAuthority.description: Description of the process and individuals authorized to make decisions in the developer governance process.

DeveloperGovernanceStructure.description: Description of the developer governance structure including board members and processes.

DeveloperIndependentSystemOperatorExperi.description: Description of developer's experience in various Independent System Operator (ISO) regional energy markets.

DeveloperMegawattConstructionLocations.description: Description of locations where developer has developed Megawatt construction.

DeveloperMegawattConstructionNumberOfPro.description: Number of Megawatt construction projects developer has performed.

DeveloperOrganizationStructure.description: Description of developer staff and internal organizational structure.

DeveloperPastFunds.description: Description of past funds the developer has been involved with including size, returns, years the funds were created, investor base and investment guidelines.

DeveloperPortfolioGuaranteeOutput.description: kWh output guaranteed by the developer for the portfolio.

DeveloperPortfolioPerformanceGuarantee.description: Guaranteed output as percent of P50 energy production estimate for the portfolio.

DeveloperPortfolioPerformanceGuaranteeDo.description: Link to the Developer Portfolio Performance Guarantee document.

DeveloperPortfolioPerformanceGuaranteeEx.description: Expiration date of the developer performance guarantee for the portfolio.

DeveloperPortfolioPerformanceGuaranteeIn.description: Initiation date of the developer performance guarantee for the portfolio.

DeveloperPortfolioPerformanceGuaranteeTe.description: Term of the developer performance guarantee for the portfolio which may be in years or months. The value should be entered using the ISO8601 format of PnYnMnDTnHnMnS. For example, a 5-year term would be represented as P5Y, a 3-month term as P3M, and a 4-year, 6-month and 10-day term would be represented as P4Y6M10D.

DeveloperPortfolioPerformanceType.description: Description of the developer performance guarantee type for the portfolio.

DeveloperProjectGuaranteeOutput.description: kWh output guaranteed by the developer for the project.

DeveloperProjectPerformanceGuarantee.description: Guaranteed output as percent of P50 energy production estimate for the project.

DeveloperProjectPerformanceGuaranteeDocu.description: Link to the Developer project Performance Guarantee document.

DeveloperProjectPerformanceGuaranteeExpi.description: Expiration date of the developer performance guarantee for the project.

DeveloperProjectPerformanceGuaranteeInit.description: Initiation date of the developer performance guarantee for the project.

DeveloperProjectPerformanceGuaranteeTerm.description: Term of the developer performance guarantee for the project which may be in years or months. The value should be entered using the ISO8601 format of PnYnMnDTnHnMnS. For example, a 5-year term would be represented as P5Y, a 3-month term as P3M, and a 4-year, 6-month and 10-day term would be represented as P4Y6M10D.

DeveloperProjectPerformanceType.description: Description of the developer performance guarantee type for the project.

DeveloperPreferredIndependentEngineers.description: Description of developers preferred independent engineers, contact information and other information including willingness to allow other stakeholders to contact them directly.

DeveloperProjectCommissioningAndPerforma.description: Description of developer project commissioning and performance testing methods.

DeveloperRenewableOperatingExperience.description: Description of the developers renewable operating experience for this fund and in aggregate, project names, MW produced, location, geography, performance including availability and production relative to underwriting, commercial operations date, percent of ownership, and indicate if they are managing members of tax equity.

DeveloperStaffingAndSubcontractor.description: Description of developer staffing, for example, number and titles of staff versus number and qualifications of subcontractors. Qualifications can include location and safety record.

DeveloperSubcontractorUse.description: Description of developer use and qualifications of EPC (Engineering Procurement and Construction) subcontractors and preferred EPCs.

DeveloperUseAndQualificationOfEquipment.description: Description of the use and qualification of equipment, for example module accelerated lifetime testing, Independent Engineering reports, and preferred equipment.

DeviationsFromMeasurementProcedures.description: Description of deviations from the test procedures in IEC 61724-3.

DeviceCost.description: Aggregate cost of the device from start of the installation to date.

DivisionOfStateArchitectApprovalDate.description: Date on which Division of State Architect approval was obtained.

DivisionOfStateArchitectApprovalLink.description: Link to Division of State Architect approval notice.

DivisionOfStateArchitectApprovalRequired.description: Indication as to whether Division of State Architect approval is required.

DivisionOfStateArchitectApprovalStatus.description: Status of Division of State Architect approval.

EasementReportAvailabilityOfDocument.description: Indicates if the Easement Report is available. If it is available, TRUE; if it is not available, FALSE.

EasementReportAvailabilityOfDocumentExce.description: Indicates if there are exceptions to the Easement Report or issues raised. If there are exceptions, TRUE; if there are no exceptions, FALSE.

EasementReportAvailabilityOfFinalDocumen.description: Indicates if the Easement Report is available in final form. If it is available in fnal form, TRUE; if it is only available in draft form, FALSE.

EasementReportCounterparties.description: Names of counterparties to the Easement Report.

EasementReportExceptionDescription.description: Description of any exceptions to the Easement or issues raised.

ElectricalGenerationRevenue.description: Revenue from generation of electricity, a process of producing electric energy by transforming other forms of energy such as nuclear, fossil fuel, solar, geothermal, hydro, and wind.

ElectricalInspectionAvailabilityOfDocume.description: Indicates if the Electrical Inspection is available. If it is available, TRUE; if it is not available, FALSE.
Indicates if there are exceptions to the Electrical Inspection or issues raised. If there are exceptions, TRUE; if there are no exceptions, FALSE.

ElectricalInspectionAvailabilityOfFinalD.description: Indicates if the Electrical Inspection is available in final form. If it is available in fnal form, TRUE; if it is only available in draft form, FALSE.

ElectricalInspectionCounterparties.description: Names of counterparties to the Electrical Inspection.

ElectricalInspectionDocumentLink.description: Link to the Electrical Inspection document.

ElectricalInspectionEffectiveDate.description: Effective date of the Electrical Inspection.

ElectricalInspectionExceptionDescription.description: Description of any exceptions to the Electrical Inspection or issues raised.

ElectricalInspectionExpirationDate.description: Expiration date of the Electrical Inspection.

EmployeeRole.description: Description of the role of the employee, for example transaction documents or due diligence.

EmployeeRoleLevel.description: Indicates the level of the employee, for example, lead or support.

EmployeeRoleType.description: Indicates whether the employee role was on a fund or a project.

EndDateOfElectricalEnergyTest.description: Time stamp indicating last day of IEC 61724-3 test, administered under OD-402.

EndDateOfElectricalPowerTest.description: Time stamp indicating the final day of the IEC 61724-2 test, administered under OD-401 or OD-402.

OperatingExpensesCostPerWatt.description: Generally recurring costs associated with normal operations except for the portion of these expenses which can be clearly related to production and included in cost of sales or services. Includes selling, general and administrative expense. Value should be reported as amount per watt. The StatementScenarioAxis should be used to report values that are predicted. No axis should be used to report values that are actual.

AssetManagementCostPerWatt.description: The aggregate costs related to asset management during the reporting period. Value should be reported as amount per watt. The StatementScenarioAxis should be used to report values that are predicted. No axis should be used to report values that are actual.

GeneralInsuranceExpensePerWatt.description: The expense in the period incurred with respect to protection provided by insurance entities against risks other than risks associated with production (which are allocated to cost of sales). Value should be reported as amount per watt. The StatementScenarioAxis should be used to report values that are predicted. No axis should be used to report values that are actual.

ExciseAndSalesTaxPerWatt.description: The amount of excise and sales taxes included in sales and revenues, which are then deducted as a cost of sales. Includes excise taxes, which are applied to specific types of transactions or items (such as gasoline or alcohol); and sales, use and value added taxes, which are applied to a broad class of revenue-producing transactions involving a wide range of goods and services.  Value should be reported as amount per watt. The StatementScenarioAxis should be used to report values that are predicted. No axis should be used to report values that are actual.

RealEstateTaxExpensePerWatt.description: A tax based on the assessed value of real estate by the local government. The tax is usually based on the value of property (including the land). Value should be reported as amount per watt. The StatementScenarioAxis should be used to report values that are predicted. No axis should be used to report values that are actual.

UtilitiesCostsPerWatt.description: Utilities costs incurred during the reporting period for services, such as water, sewer, gas, electricity and telephone required to operate a building. Value should be reported as amount per watt. The StatementScenarioAxis should be used to report values that are predicted. No axis should be used to report values that are actual.

OtherExpensesPerWatt.description: Amount of expense classified as other. Value should be reported as amount per watt. The StatementScenarioAxis should be used to report values that are predicted. No axis should be used to report values that are actual.

AuditingFeePerWatt.description: Fee for auditing financial information. Value should be reported as amount per watt. The StatementScenarioAxis should be used to report values that are predicted. No axis should be used to report values that are actual.

TaxPreparationFeePerWatt.description: Fee for preparing tax returns. Value should be reported as amount per watt. The StatementScenarioAxis should be used to report values that are predicted. No axis should be used to report values that are actual.

OtherAdministrativeFeesPerWatt.description: Other administrative fees. Value should be reported as amount per watt. The StatementScenarioAxis should be used to report values that are predicted. No axis should be used to report values that are actual.

SiteLeasePaymentPerWatt.description: Site lease expense. Value should be reported as amount per watt. The StatementScenarioAxis should be used to report values that are predicted. No axis should be used to report values that are actual.

CurrentFederalTaxExpenseBenefitPerWatt.description: Amount of current federal tax expense (benefit) pertaining to income (loss) from continuing operations. Value should be reported as amount per watt. The StatementScenarioAxis should be used to report values that are predicted. No axis should be used to report values that are actual.

CurrentStateAndLocalTaxExpenseBenefitPer.description: Amount of current state and local tax expense (benefit) pertaining to income (loss) from continuing operations. Value should be reported as amount per watt. The StatementScenarioAxis should be used to report values that are predicted. No axis should be used to report values that are actual.

OtherTaxExpenseBenefitPerWatt.description: Amount of other income tax expense (benefit). Value should be reported as amount per watt. The StatementScenarioAxis should be used to report values that are predicted. No axis should be used to report values that are actual.

CostsAndExpensesPerWatt.description: Total costs of sales and operating expenses for the period. Value should be reported as amount per watt. The StatementScenarioAxis should be used to report values that are predicted. No axis should be used to report values that are actual.

PaymentsForRentPerWatt.description: Cash payments to lessor's for use of assets under operating leases. Value should be reported as amount per watt. The StatementScenarioAxis should be used to report values that are predicted. No axis should be used to report values that are actual.

ElectricalGenerationRevenuePerWatt.description: Revenue from generation of electricity, a process of producing electric energy by transforming other forms of energy such as nuclear, fossil fuel, solar, geothermal, hydro, and wind. Value should be reported as amount per watt. The StatementScenarioAxis should be used to report values that are predicted. No axis should be used to report values that are actual.

PBIRevenuePerWatt.description: Revenue from energy production based incentive. Value should be reported as amount per watt. The StatementScenarioAxis should be used to report values that are predicted. No axis should be used to report values that are actual.

RECRevenuePerWatt.description: Revenue from renewable energy credits. Value should be reported as amount per watt. The StatementScenarioAxis should be used to report values that are predicted. No axis should be used to report values that are actual.

RebateRevenuePerWatt.description: Revenue from renewable energy rebate program. Value should be reported as amount per watt. The StatementScenarioAxis should be used to report values that are predicted. No axis should be used to report values that are actual.

OtherIncomePerWatt.description: Amount of revenue and income classified as other. Value should be reported as amount per watt. The StatementScenarioAxis should be used to report values that are predicted. No axis should be used to report values that are actual.

RevenuesPerWatt.description: Amount of revenue recognized from goods sold, services rendered, insurance premiums, or other activities that constitute an earning process. Includes, but is not limited to, investment and interest income before deduction of interest expense when recognized as a component of revenue, and sales and trading gain (loss). Value should be reported as amount per watt. The StatementScenarioAxis should be used to report values that are predicted. No axis should be used to report values that are actual.

CostOfServicesDepreciationAndAmortizatio.description: Depreciation of property, plant and equipment directly related to services rendered by an entity during the reporting period. Value should be reported as amount per watt. The StatementScenarioAxis should be used to report values that are predicted. No axis should be used to report values that are actual.

PrincipalAmountOutstandingOnLoansManaged.description: This is the sum of principal amount outstanding for both securitized and unsecuritized loans of all types. Value should be reported as amount per watt. The StatementScenarioAxis should be used to report values that are predicted. No axis should be used to report values that are actual.

InvestedCapitalPerWatt.description: The total invested capital at the end of the reporting period. Value should be reported as amount per watt. The StatementScenarioAxis should be used to report values that are predicted. No axis should be used to report values that are actual.

TotalOfAllProjectAccountBalancesPerWatt.description: Total of all project account balances at the end of the reporting period. Value should be reported as amount per watt. The StatementScenarioAxis should be used to report values that are predicted. No axis should be used to report values that are actual.

TaxEquityCashDistributionsPerWatt.description: Amount of payment to tax-equity investors in the reporting period. Value should be reported as amount per watt. The StatementScenarioAxis should be used to report values that are predicted. No axis should be used to report values that are actual.

OtherPaymentsToFinanciersPerWatt.description: Amount of payments to other financiers in the reporting period. Value should be reported as amount per watt. The StatementScenarioAxis should be used to report values that are predicted. No axis should be used to report values that are actual.

HypotheticalLiquidationAtBookValueBalanc.description: The total Hypothetical Liquidation at Book Value balance at the end of the reporting period. Value should be reported as amount per watt. The StatementScenarioAxis should be used to report values that are predicted. No axis should be used to report values that are actual.

DebtInstrumentPeriodicPaymentPrincipalPe.description: Amount of the required periodic payments applied to principal. Value should be reported as amount per watt. The StatementScenarioAxis should be used to report values that are predicted. No axis should be used to report values that are actual.

DebtInstrumentPeriodicPaymentInterestPer.description: Amount of the required periodic payments applied to interest. Value should be reported as amount per watt. The StatementScenarioAxis should be used to report values that are predicted. No axis should be used to report values that are actual.

DeficitRestorationObligationPerWatt.description: Amount of deficit restoration obligation in the reporting period. Value should be reported as amount per watt. The StatementScenarioAxis should be used to report values that are predicted. No axis should be used to report values that are actual.

DeficitRestorationObligationLimitPerWatt.description: Limit to deficit restoration obligation. Value should be reported as amount per watt. The StatementScenarioAxis should be used to report values that are predicted. No axis should be used to report values that are actual.

DemandCharge.description: The maximum amount of power (kW) drawn for any given time interval (typically 15 minutes) during the billing period, multiplied by the relevant demand charge ($/kW). Demand charges are fees applied to the electric bills of commercial and industrial customers based upon the highest amount of power drawn during any interval during the billing period.

EnergyCharge.description: The amount of energy (kWh) consumed, multiplied by the relevant price of energy ($/kWh) during the billing period.

EnergyBudgetDate.description: Date on which the budget was entered or corrected.

EnergyBudgetIdentifier.description: Identifier for the energy budget related to a site.

EnergyBudgetPeriodicity.description: Specifies periodicity of budget, for example monthly, quarterly, semi-annually, annual.

EnergyBudgetPhase.description: Identifies the phase of the budget, for example, closing, initial funding, final funding.

EnergyBudgetSource.description: Description of the source of the budget, for example, sponsor, internal or Independent Engineer.

EnergyBudgetStatus.description: Identifies the status of the budget, for example, preliminary, indicative or final.

EnergyBudgetSystemPerformanceDegradation.description: Annual percent degradation of system performance.

EnergyBudgetVersion.description: Description of the version of the budget.

EnergyBudgetYear1CapacityFactorPercent.description: First year capacity factor percent, pre-availability and curtailment

EnergyBudgetYear1EnergyYieldPercent.description: First year output in megawatt hours (MWh) divided by megawatt hours at peak (MWp), pre-availability and curtailment.

MeasuredEnergyAvailabilityDifference.description: A PV system or part of a system is considered to be available when its status is observed to be functional. Per IECRE 61724-3, this measure can be calculated as simple difference, percent difference, or ratio calculation. This concept should be reported as a Difference, calculated as Measured - Expected.

ExpectedEnergyAtUnavailableTimesExcludin.description: A PV system or part of a system is considered to be unavailable when its status is observed to be non-functional.This measure reports the amount of energy that is unavailable, excluding issues that are outside of the plant's control.

ExpectedEnergyAtUnavailableTimes.description: A PV system or part of a system is considered to be unavailable when its status is observed to be non-functional.This measure reports the amount of energy that is unavailable.

ExpectedEnergyAvailabilityEstimateRatio.description: Expected Energy Availability Estimate is modelled predicted energy for unity availability, and can be calculated by dividing ExpectedEnergyAtTheRevenueMeter by Predicted_Energy_Availability. This element can be used with the PeriodAxis to indicate the period such as year and has a period type of instant to measure a point in time.

ExpectedEnergyAtArrayDC.description: Expected energy in DC kWh produced at the array. This element should be used with the PeriodAxis to indicate the period of measurement.

ExpectedEnergyAtTheRevenueMeterForPeriod.description: Expected Active Electrical Production at the revenue meter for indicated time period in kWh per IEC 61724-3 using measured weather data during times of availability and including adjustments for parasitic losses. See Section 6.6.6 of IEC 61724-3. This element can be used with the PeriodAxis to indicate the period of measurement and has a period type of instant to measure a point in time. If no Period [Axis] is used, the time period for the value is from the date of the value in the instance document to the end of the life of the system.

ExpectedEnergyAtTheRevenueMeter.description: Expected Active Electrical Production at the revenue meter for indicated time period in kWh per IEC 61724-3 using measured weather data during times of availability and including adjustments for parasitic losses. See Section 6.6.6 of IEC 61724-3.  This element is defined as the sum of electrical production over a period of time, for example the first day of the month to the last day of the month, and has a period type of duration. This should not be used with the Period [Axis].

ExpectedEnergyAtRevenueMeterInceptionToD.description: Expected Active Electrical Production at the revenue meter for indicated time period in kWh per IEC 61724-3 using measured weather data during times of availability and including adjustments for parasitic losses. See Section 6.6.6 of IEC 61724-3. Measured from inception to date.

OperationsAndMaintenanceCostPerWatt.description: Cost of ownership for system over the time period of the test in currency/W.

ExposureReportAvailabilityOfExceptions.description: Indicates if there are exceptions to the Exposure Report. If there are exceptions, TRUE; if there are no exceptions, FALSE.

FinanceOverviewIncentivesDescription.description: Description of the incentives for the project.

FinanceOverviewOperationsAndMaintenanceC.description: Description of the Operations and Maintenance contract.

FinanceOverviewTypeOfProject.description: Description of the type of project.

FinancialContractForSystemType.description: Type of financial contract between a homeowner and a residential solar company, or between a commercial building owner and a C&I solar company, which can be Lease, PPA, Loan, Cash, Upfront, PSA or Unknown.

FinancialContractForSystemRate.description: Rate stated in the financial contract between a homeowner and a residential solar company, or between a commercial building owner and a C&I solar company, related to the system, in amount of kWh.

FinancialContractForSystemEscalatorPerce.description: Escalator which is the percentage increase in rate per year in the financial contract between a homeowner and a residential solar company, or between a commercial building owner and a C&I solar company.

FinancialContractForSystemLengthInMonths.description: Length of the financial contract in months between a homeowner and a residential solar company, or between a commercial building owner and a C&I solar company.

FinancialContractForSystemUpFrontPurchas.description: Amount paid by the customer upfront in a contract between a homeowner and a residential solar company, or between a commercial building owner and a C&I solar company.

FinancialContractForSystemPaceEligibilit.description: Indication as to whether the financial contract between a homeowner and a residential solar company, or between a commercial building owner and a C&I solar company, is eligible for the PACE program.

FinancialContractForSystemOfftakerName.description: Name of the offtaker for the financial contract, used with C&I customers.

Indicates if there are exceptions to the Financial Lease Schedule or issues raised. If there are exceptions, TRUE; if there are no exceptions, FALSE.

FinancialPerformanceCollateralAccountBal.description: Actual or forecast collateral account balance. Values reported as forecast should use the StatementScenarioAxis.

FinancialPerformanceEarningsBeforeIncome.description: Earnings before income tax, depreciation or amortization, actual and forecast. (EBITDA). Values reported as forecast should use the StatementScenarioAxis.

FinancialPerformanceEstimatesCollateralA.description: Collateral account balance, estimate made at start of project.

FinancialPerformanceEstimatesEarningsBef.description: Earnings before income tax, depreciation and amortization, estimate made at start of project.

FinancialPerformanceEstimatesFutureSurpl.description: Future surplus cash to developer, estimate made at start of project.

FinancialPerformanceEstimatesLeaseRentPa.description: Lease rent payments, net of collateral account, estimate made at start of project.

FinancialPerformanceEstimatesRevenuesEst.description: Revenues, estimate made at start of project.

FinancialPerformanceFutureSurplusCashToD.description: Future surplus cash to developer, actual or forecast. Values reported as forecast should use the StatementScenarioAxis.

FinancialTransactionForSystemInvoiceLine.description: Text of line item on the invoice for the financial transaction related to the system.

FinancialTransactionType.description: Type of financial transaction which can be Credit Applied, Customer Payment, Customer Bill, Credit, Expected Prepayment, Expected Rebate, Fund Rebate, Operating Expenses, Lease Management Fee, PPA Operations and Maintenance, Lease Operations and Maintenance, PPA Miscellaneous Expenses, PPA Management Fee, Lease Miscellaneous Expenses, Lease Insurance, PPA Insurance, PPA Transaction Manager Fee, Lease Transaction Manager Fee, Customer Prepayment, ACH Settlement Credit, Principal Cash Paid to Beneficiary, Contribution to Principal Cash, Book Transfer Debit, Teller Deposit Credit, Book Transfer Credit, or Remote Deposit Credit.

FinancialTransactionForSystemSubType.description: Description of a custom transaction that is unique to a fund or billing entity.

FinancialTransactionForFundDateOfTransac.description: Date of the financial transaction related to the fund.

FinancingEventFirstFinancingEntity.description: Name of first entity providing project financing.

MerchantPowerSalesPercent.description: Merchant power plants are commercial, independent plants competing to sell energy. This value should represent the percent of merchant power sales.

FinancingEventFirstFinancingLoanNumber.description: Loan number for the first loan made.

FinancingEventFundOrProject.description: Indication as to whether the financing event is related to the total fund or an individual portfolio.

FinancingEventStatus.description: Description of the status of the financing event, for example, In Process or Finalized.

FinancingEventType.description: Description of the type of financing event, for example, an origination request, signing a non-binding commitment, signing a binding committment, signing and closing, closing, or funding.

FirmwareVersion.description: Description of the firmware version of the device.

FundAttributeSubsetIdentifier.description: Identifier used to link a subset of attributes within a fund, for example grouping the characteristics of a portion of a fund owned by a particular entity.

FundBankInvestment.description: Description of the type of investment the bank has made in the fund, for example did they invest on the initial round or were they assigned a portion by another investor.

FundBankRole.description: Description of the banks role in the fund. For example, the bank could be Co-Investor, Lead Investor, Single Investor, or have some other role.

FundClosingDate.description: Date on which the fund closed.

FundConstructionFinancing.description: Indicates that the fund has construction financing. If the fund does have construction financing, TRUE. If it does not, FALSE.

FundDebtFinancing.description: Indicates that the fund has financing debt. If the fund does have financing debt, TRUE. If it does not, FALSE.

FundDescriptionAnalyst.description: Name of analyst covering the fund.

FundDescriptionAvailabilityOfExpenseSink.description: Availability of Expense Sinking Fund which is a reserve account to pay for expenses. If available, TRUE; if not available, FALSE.

FundDescriptionAveragePowerPurchaseAgree.description: Average term in years of Power Purchase Agreement within a fund. The value should be entered using the ISO8601 format of PnYnMnDTnHnMnS. For example, a 5-year term would be represented as P5Y, a 3-month term as P3M, and a 4-year, 6-month and 10-day term would be represented as P4Y6M10D.

FundDescriptionCurrentSimplePaybackEndDa.description: End date of simple payback period.

FundDescriptionCurrentSimplePaybackStart.description: Start date of simple payback period.

FundDescriptionFundCrossCollateralized.description: Indication that fund is cross collateralized. If cross collateralized, TRUE; if not cross collateralized, FALSE.

FundDescriptionFundNameplateCapacityInve.description: Nameplate capacity in kWac of inverters for all projects in the fund.

FundDescriptionFundNameplateCapacityPVAr.description: Nameplate capacity of PV arrays for all projects in the fund in kWdc

FundDescriptionInvestorHoldingCompanyNam.description: Name of fund investor holding company.

FundDescriptionNumberofOffTakersInFund.description: Number of off takers of power, Renewable Energy Credits or other revenue sources in a fund.

FundDescriptionNumberOfSystemsInFund.description: Number of systems in a fund.

FundDescriptionNumberOneStrength.description: Description of most important strength of the fund.

FundDescriptionNumberOneWeakness.description: Description of most important weakness of the fund.

FundDescriptionPricingAdvisor.description: Name of pricing advisor which is the individual who runs the pricing model and could be the banker.

FundDescriptionProFormaGrossIncomeBalanc.description: Amount of the Pro Forma gross income balance.

FundDescriptionProFormaNetIncomeBalance.description: Amount of the proforma net income balance.

FundDescriptionPropertyInsuranceHurrican.description: Description of property insurance to cover hurricane/wind requirement.

FundDescriptionPropertyInsurancePollutio.description: Description of property insurance to cover pollution requirement.

For example, a 5-year term would be represented as P5Y, a 3-month term as P3M, and a 4-year, 6-month and 10-day term would be represented as P4Y6M10D.

FundDescriptionSponsorCompanyName.description: Name of sponsor who brings the project to the bank. It is usually the project developer.

FundDescriptionSponsorName.description: Name of the sponsor who brings the project to the bank.

FundDescriptionTaxEquityProviderContribu.description: Amount of contribution of tax equity provider.

FundFinancingType.description: Description of the type of financing structure, for example, Partnership, Sale/Leaseback, Other.

FundIdentifier.description: A line item used to identify the fund. This must use the identifier defined on the FundIdentifierAxis.

GenTieLineLength.description: Length of Gen Tie Line (interconnecting power line).

GeoLocationAtEntrance.description: Latitude and longitude at system entrance in degrees. Note that values reported for this concept are different than values reported for Latitude and Longitude at the revenue meter.

GuaranteeAmountCap.description: Maximum amount of money that can be refunded to the guarantee.

Indicates if there are exceptions to the Guarantee and Pledge Agreement or issues raised. If there are exceptions, TRUE; if there are no exceptions, FALSE.

GuaranteeAndPledgeAgreementEffectiveDate.description: Effective date of the Guarantee and Pledge Agreement.

GuaranteeAndPledgeAgreementExceptionDesc.description: Description of any exceptions to the Guarantee and Pledge Agreement or issues raised.

GuaranteeAndPledgeAgreementLink.description: Link to the Guarantee And Pledge Agreement document.

GuaranteeAndPledgeDocumentLink.description: Link to the Guarantee And Pledge document.

GuaranteeMeasurementUnits.description: Description of units used to measure the guarantee. For example, performance guarantees require certain level of energy output (kWh).

GuaranteePaymentMaximum.description: Maximum payment that can be made during a reconciliation period.

GuaranteePaymentScalingFactor.description: Percent that the guarantee is willing to pay of the loss incurred, for example, may specify that 50% of the lost revenue will be paid.

GuaranteeReconciliationPeriod.description: Period within which the guarantee must be met, for example, year or month.

IECRECertificateNumber.description: IECRE certificate number, defined as sector(PV, wind, marine).year.IECREOperativeDocument.uniquesystemid.certificatenumber. For example AAAA.YYYY.OD4XX.PPPPP.CCCCC.AAAA.

IECRECertificateTimeStamp.description: Timestamp for completion of the IECRE commissioning.

IECRECertificateDate.description: Date the IECRE certificate was issued.

IncentivesFederalTaxIncentiveIndemnityCa.description: Cap on indemnity that the investor receives from the project developer for potential investment tax credit recapture per the Tax Indemnity Agreement.

IncentivesFederalTaxIncentiveIndemnityPr.description: Provider of indemnification, for example, the developer/sponsor, per the Tax Indemnity Agreement.

IncentivesFederalTaxIncentiveType.description: Description of federal tax incentive indemnity type per the Tax Indemnity Agreement.

IncentivesNameOfRecipient.description: Name of the individual or organization who can take advantage of the incentive.

IncentivesPercentFederalInvestmentTaxCre.description: The percent of the federal Investment Tax Credit that has been vested.

IncentivesPerformanceActualIncentivesInc.description: Actual incentive cost from inception to date, cumulative per month, cumulative per year.

IncentivesPerformanceBasedIncentiveAmend.description: Execution date of the performance based incentive amendment.
Expiration date of the performance based incentive term.
Initiation date of the performance based incentive term.

IncentivesPerformanceBasedIncentiveEscal.description: Annual escalation of the performance based incentive value (percent)

IncentivesPerformanceBasedIncentiveFirmV.description: Guaranteed volume of energy in kWh to be delivered by the project company under the terms of the Performace Based Incentive Contract.

IncentivesPerformanceBasedIncentiveInvoi.description: Invoice date for the performance based incentive.

IncentivesPerformanceBasedIncentivePayme.description: Date of the payment deadline for the performance based incentive.
Description of the payment method for the performance based incentive.

IncentivesPerformanceBasedIncentivePorti.description: Portion of site used to measure performance based incentive as percent of total number of units in site.

IncentivesPerformanceBasedIncentiveProgr.description: Description of the performance based incentive program.

IncentivesPerformanceBasedIncentiveRate.description: Rate of the performance based incentive in amount per kWh.

IncentivesPerformanceBasedIncentiveTerm.description: Term of the performance based incentive. The value should be entered using the ISO8601 format of PnYnMnDTnHnMnS. For example, a 5-year term would be represented as P5Y, a 3-month term as P3M, and a 4-year, 6-month and 10-day term would be represented as P4Y6M10D.

IncentivesPerformanceExpectedIncentivesI.description: Expected cumulative incentive cost from inception to date.

IncentivesPerformanceExpectedIncentivesP.description: Expected incentive cost per kWh production from inception to date, cumulative per month, cumulative per year.

IncentivesPortionUnits.description: Number of units used to measure power system capacity for performance based incentive.

IncentivesRebateAmount.description: Amount of the rebate coming from the state.

IncentivesRebatePaymentTiming.description: Description of rebate payment timing, for example monthly or quarterly payment.

IncentivesStateTaxCreditFirmVolume.description: Guaranteed volume of energy to be delivered as part of the state tax credit agreement (in kWh).

IncentivesStateTaxCreditPortionOfSite.description: State tax credit percentage of site based on units.

IncentivesStateTaxCreditPortionUnits.description: Number of units used to measure power system capacity for state tax credit.

IncentivesStateTaxCreditProgram.description: Description of the state tax credit program.

IncentivesStateTaxCreditRecipient.description: Name of the recipient of the state tax credit.

IncentivesStateTaxCredits.description: State tax credit in currency per kWh.

IncentivesStateTaxCreditsCurrent.description: Indication as to whether state tax credits are current. If they are current, TRUE; if they are not current, FALSE.

IncentivesStateTaxCreditsEscalator.description: Percent of state tax credit escalator.

IncentivesStateTaxCreditsTerm.description: Term of the state tax credit. The value should be entered using the ISO8601 format of PnYnMnDTnHnMnS. For example, a 5-year term would be represented as P5Y, a 3-month term as P3M, and a 4-year, 6-month and 10-day term would be represented as P4Y6M10D.

IncentivesStateTaxCreditTermExpirationDa.description: Expiration date of the state tax credit.

IncentivesStateTaxCreditVolumeCap.description: Volume cap in kWh of state tax credit.

IncentivesTaxEquityPartnerPartnerSharesP.description: Partner shares as percent of class equity, for example,class A and class B shares. The ratio can be can be expressed for all partners or for individual partners.
Total partner shares (regardless of class) as a percent of total equity.

IncentivesTaxEquityPartnerSharesPercentO.description: Number of shares of the tax equity partner as a percent of the total class equity.
Number of shares of the tax equity partner as a percent of a specific class equity.

IncentivesVolumeCap.description: Volume cap on performance based incentive in kWh.

IncomeTaxExpenseBenefit.description: Amount of current income tax expense (benefit) and deferred income tax expense (benefit) pertaining to continuing operations.

IncomeTaxExpenseBenefitIntraperiodTaxAll.description: Amount of income tax expense (benefit) for continuing operations, discontinued operations, other comprehensive income, and items charged (credited) directly to shareholders' equity.

SuretyObligee.description: The name of the obligee to a surety bond, which is a promise by a surety or guarantor to pay one party (the obligee) a certain amount if a second party (the principal) fails to meet some obligation, such as fulfilling the terms of a contract.

InsuranceConsultant.description: Name of insurance consultant (hired to work on the solar installation project).

Indicates if there are exceptions to the Interconnection Agreement. If there are exceptions, TRUE; if there are no exceptions, FALSE.

InterconnectionAgreementEffectiveDate.description: Effective date of the interconnection agreement, allowing the project company to distribute energy onto the electrical grid.

InterconnectionAgreementExceptionDescrip.description: Description of any exceptions to the Interconnection Agreement.

InterconnectionAgreementExpirationDate.description: Expiration date of the Interconnection Agreement.

InterconnectionAgreementPointOfInterconn.description: Location of the interconnection named as GPS coordinate or address, per the Interconnection Agreement, allowing the project company to distribute energy onto the electrical grid.

InterconnectionAgreementSpecialFeatures.description: Description of special features in the interconnection agreement, which allows the project company to distribute energy onto the electrical grid.

InterconnectionAgreementType.description: Description of the type of interconnection agreement type allowing the project company to distribute energy onto the electrical grid, for example, distributed generation, small or large.
