InterconnectionApprovalExceptionDescript.description: Description of any exceptions to the Interconnection Approval or issues raised.

InterconnectionApprovalExpirationDate.description: Expiration date of the Interconnection Approval.

InterestRateOnOverduePayments.description: Interest rate charged on overdue lease payments.

InverterBackupOutputMaximumContinuousCur.description: Amount of continuous current per phase of the inverter.

InverterBatteryInputContinuousPowerDC.description: Amount of continuous DC power that can be drawn into the battery for the inverter, in apparent power.

InverterBatteryInputNumberOfBatteriesPer.description: Number of batteries required per inverter.

InverterBatteryInputPeakPowerDC.description: Peak apparent power that can be drawn into the battery for the inverter.

InverterBatteryInputSupportedBatteryType.description: Description of battery types that can be used to support the inverter.

InverterBuiltInMeterAvailability.description: Indicates if the inverter has a built-in meter. If it has a built-in meter, TRUE; if it does not, FALSE.

InverterCaliforniaEnergyCommissionWeight.description: California Energy Commission (CEC) weighted energy efficiency rating of the inverter. In contrast to peak efficiency, it is a measure of average efficiency.

InverterCertificationListing.description: Description of certifications available for the inverter.

ModuleCertificationListing.description: Description of certifications available for the module.

OptimizerCertificationListing.description: Description of certifications available for the optimizer.

InverterCommunication.description: Description of the communication system for the inverter.

InverterCooling.description: Description of the inverter cooling system.

InverterDCOptimized.description: Indication as to whether the inverter is DC optimized. If DC optimized, TRUE; if not DC optimized, FALSE.

InverterDesignFactor.description: Multiplier indicating the amount that the inverter can operate at above the inverter DC nameplate capacity. For example, at a design factor of 1.1, can safely operate 10% above the stated nameplate capacity rating.

InverterDisconnectionType.description: Description of the inverter disconnection type.

InverterEnclosureEnvironmentalRating.description: Description of the enclosure environmental rating for the inverter.

InverterErrorCodeData.description: Error code data provided about the inverter.

InverterEuropeanEfficiencyRatingPercent.description: European Efficiency rating of the inverter which is an averaged operating efficiency over a yearly power distribution corresponding to middle-Europe climate.

InverterFanStatusFlag.description: Status of the inverter fan. If fan is working, TRUE; if fan is not working, FALSE.

InverterGroundFaultDetectorInterrupterDe.description: Description of the Inverter Ground Fault Detector Interrupter which is a fuse that trips when ground fault current exceeds the ampere rating of the fuse.

InverterGroundFaultDetectorInterrupterTh.description: Threshold amount of current in the Inverter Ground Fault Detector Interrupter which is a fuse that trips when ground fault current exceeds the ampere rating of the fuse.

InverterGroundingAvailability.description: Indication as to whether grounding is available for the inverter. If Ungrounded (Transformerless), FALSE. If Grounded, TRUE.

InverterHarmonicsTheshold.description: Expected percent limit of the change in frequency from expected frequency which is the harmonics, a method of characterizing the flow of the current. For example, the frequency is expected to be less than 4% of the expected frequency.

InverterHasCertificationIEC61683.description: Inverter has certification IEC61683, for Power Conditioners - Procedure for Measuring Efficiency.

InverterHasCertificationIEC62109-1.description: Inverter has certification IEC62109-1, for Safety of Power Converters ofr Use in PV Power Systems, Part 1: General Requirements.

InverterHasCertificationIEC62109-2.description: Inverter has certification IEC62109-2, Safety of Power Converters for Use in PV Power Systems, Part 2: Particular Requirements for Inverters.

InverterHasCertificationOther.description: Inverter has certification other than UL1741, IEC61683, IEC62109-1, or IEC62109-2. If it does, then list the certifications.

InverterHasCertificationUL1741.description: Inverter has certification UL1741, for Inverters, Converters, Controllers and Interconnection System Equipment for Use with Distributed Energy Resources.

InverterHasDCDisconnectDevice.description: Indication as to whether the inverter has a DC disconnect device; if it does, TRUE; if it does not, FALSE.

InverterHasGroundFaultMonitoring.description: Indication as to whether the inverter has a ground fault monitoring; if it does, TRUE; if it does not, FALSE.

InverterInputMaximumMPPVoltage.description: Maximum voltage at which the inverter can deliver its rated power

InverterInputMaximumOperatingCurrentDC.description: The maximum input DC current that can be connected to the inverter.

InverterInputMaximumPowerDC.description: Maximum amount of apparent power input that the inverter can safely draw.

InverterInputMaximumVoltageDC.description: Maximum rated DC voltage input of the inverter.

InverterInputMinimumVoltageDC.description: Minimum rated DC voltage input of the inverter.

InverterInputMinimumMPPVoltage.description: Minimum voltage at which the inverter can deliver its rated power

InverterInputNumberOfMaximumPowerPointTr.description: Number of Maximum Power Point Trackers (MPPT).

InverterInputRatedVoltageDC.description: Rated DC voltage of the inverter.

InverterInputShortCircuitCurrentDC.description: Amount of current going through the inverter when the voltage is zero.

InverterInputStringsPerMaximumPowerPoint.description: Number of strings or input per Maximum Power Point (MPPT).

InverterIsMPPT.description: Indicates if the inverter is an MPPT inverter. The MPPT is a circuit (typically a DC to DC converter) used to maximize the energy available from the connected solar module arrays at any time during its operation. If it is an MMPT inverter, TRUE; if it is not, FALSE.

InverterMaximumEfficiency.description: The ratio of output power (or energy) to input power (or energy) for the inverter.

InverterMaximumStartVoltage.description: The maximum start voltage of an inverter is the maximum voltage at which the inverter begins pulling power from the array.

InverterMinimumStartVoltage.description: The start voltage of an inverter is the minimum voltage at which the inverter begins pulling power from the array.

InverterMonitoring.description: Description of the monitoring system for the inverter.

InverterMPPTOperatingRangeVoltageMaximum.description: Inverter Maximum Power Point Tracking maximum operating voltage range.

InverterMPPTOperatingRangeVoltageMinimum.description: Inverter Maximum Power Point Tracking minimum operating voltage range.

InverterNighttimePowerConsumption.description: The amount of power consumed during the night.

InverterOperatingTemperatureRangeMaximum.description: Maximum operating temperature of the solar module. Can be reported as Celsius or Fahrenheit by the preparer when specifying units in the instance document.

InverterOperatingTemperatureRangeMinimum.description: Minimum operating temperature of the solar module. Can be reported as Celsius or Fahrenheit by the preparer when specifying units in the instance document.

InverterOutputACFrequencyRangeMaximum.description: Maximum value of the range within which the frequency of the inverter allows the AC to fluctuate, in herz.

InverterOutputACFrequencyRangeMinimum.description: Minimum value of the range within which the frequency of the inverter allows the AC to fluctuate, in herz.

InverterOutputContinuousPower.description: Amount of power that can be delivered continuously by the inverter.

InverterOutputMaximumApparentPowerAC.description: Maximum, nameplate (nominal) apparent power output of the inverter, in volts-ampere.

InverterOutputMaximumCurrentAC.description: Maximum amount of current that an inverter will output, AC.

InverterOutputMaximumPowerAC.description: Maximum, nameplate (nominal) output of the inverter, measured in real power (watts) which is the amount of power actually consumed or utilized in an AC Circuit. It is also called True power or Active Power.

InverterOutputPhaseType.description: Phase type of the inverter which can be Single Phase, Three Phase WYE configuration, or Three Phase Delta configuration.

InverterOutputRatedFrequency.description: Rated frequency of the inverter in Hertz.

InverterOutputRatedPowerAC.description: Rated apparent power of the inverter per manufacturers specification in AC.

InverterOutputRatedVoltageAC.description: Rated AC voltage of the inverter.

InverterOutputVoltageRangeACMaximum.description: Maximum value of the voltage range of the inverter, per manufacturer specification.

InverterOutputVoltageRangeACMinimum.description: Minimum value of the voltage range of the inverter, per manufacturer specification.

InverterPowerFactor.description: Power factor of the inverter operating at nominal power. Power factor is the ratio of real power to apparent power.

InverterPowerFactorMinimumOverexcited.description: Minimum power factor when injecting reactive power.

InverterPowerFactorMinimumUnderexcited.description: Minimum power factor when absorbing reactive power.

InverterReversePolarityFlag.description: If the Inverter has reverse polarity, TRUE; if the inverter does not have reverse polarity, FALSE.

InverterStaticMPPTEfficiency.description: Static MPPT efficiency, which quantifies the array power captured under stable conditions.

InverterStyle.description: Description of the style of the inverter which can be Central, String, MicroInverter, Distributed, Transformerless, or Grounded.

InverterTransformerDesign.description: Description of the transformer design for the inverter.

InvestedCapital.description: The total invested capital at the end of the reporting period.

InvestmentMemo.description: Link to the Lessee Collateral Agency Agreement document.

InvestmentMemoExpirationDate.description: Expiration date of the Investment Memo.

Indicates if there are exceptions to the Invoice Including Wiring Instructions or issues raised. If there are exceptions, TRUE; if there are no exceptions, FALSE.
Indicates if the Invoice Including Wiring Instructions is available in final form. If it is available in fnal form, TRUE; if it is only available in draft form, FALSE.

LeaseAmountPayable.description: Amount payable, which is the sum of basic rent and interest payable on section 467 balance from lessee to lessor.

LeaseBankIdentifierForLessee.description: Bank identification number for the lessee.

LeaseBaseStipulatedLossValue.description: Base stipulated loss value, which is the gross amount that the investor needs to be paid to be made whole, if there is an early termination of the lease, e.g., the equipment is destroyed.

LeaseBasicRent.description: Basic rent which is the amount of rent payable on a specified date, e.g., the amount that must be paid to lessor by lessee.

LeaseCounterparty.description: Name of the counterparty to the lease.

LeaseCounterpartyJurisdiction.description: Jurisdiction of the counterparty, for example, name of the state.

LeaseCounterpartyType.description: Description of the type of counterparty. For example, trust.

LeaseDateOfExecution.description: Date of execution of the lease contract. May be the same as the commencement date of the lease.

LeaseExpirationDate1.description: Date on which lease or group of leases is set to expire, in CCYY-MM-DD format.

LeaseFederalTaxIdentifierForLessee.description: Federal tax identification number for the lessee.

LeaseInterestAccrued.description: Interest, which is the amount of interest that has accrued on the prepaid rent.

LeaseInterestPayable.description: Interest payable, which is the amount of interest that must be paid in that period.

LeaseInterestPayableOnSection467.description: Interest payable on section 467, which is the interest that has accrued on the section 467 loan balance; for each period how much interest accrued on the balance during that period which will be an amount owed by lessor to lessee.

LeaseJurisdictionAndGoverningLaw.description: Description of jurisdiction and governing law that pertains to the lease.

LeaseOneYearAverageRent.description: Average annual amount of rent over the lifetime of the lease.

LeaseProjectCostToLessor.description: Amount paid by the lessor which is probably the bank, to purchase the project.

LeaseProjectDocuments.description: Description of all major project documents related to the lease.

LeaseProportionalRent.description: Proportional rent, which is rent accrued for tax purposes. It is a calculated value to show how much rent accrues during the period.

LeaseProRataRent.description: Pro rata rent, which is the difference between rent payable and rent accrued during the previous rental period that is not included otherwise in section 467 balance or in base stipulated loss value.

LeaseSection467Balance.description: Section 467 balance, which is the cumulative difference between the amount of rent that has been paid and the amount of rent that has been accrued for tax purposes since the inception of the lease. Represents an amount that, if negative, is the amount the lessor owes to lessee; if positive, represents an amount owed by lessee to lessor.

LeaseSection467LessorBalance.description: Section 467 lessor balance, which is the sum of basic rent plus interest plus interest payable on section 467 loan balance (if positive, owed from lessor to lessee).

LeaseSixMonthsAverageRent.description: Average amount of rent over any 6 month time period during the lifetime of the lease.

LeaseStipulatedLossValue.description: Stipulated loss value, which is the net amount starting with the base stipulated loss value minus section 467 balance plus the pro rata rent.

LegalEntityIdentifier.description: Legal Entity Identifier (LEI) of the entity.

MaximumPercentThresholdForPaymentOfGuara.description: Maximum percent loss at which a refund will be paid which effectively puts a cap on the amount of refund. For example, if a guarantee specifies that a refund will be made when output falls between 95-98%, and the output falls to 97%, the refunded amount will be based on 97%. If the loss falls to 94%, the loss will be based on the maximum allowable amount at 95%. 95% is the maximum threshold for payment. Other penalities may apply if the loss falls below the threshold.

MeasuredCapacityAtTargetConditions.description: Power measured at the targeted measurement conditions per IEC 61724-2 in kW.

MeasuredEnergyAvailabilityPercent.description: Measured energy availability for the indicated time period calculated from the measured weather data and observed availability which can be obtained by dividing Expected Energy At Revenue Meter by Expected Energy At Unavailable Times. For solar, use IEC 61724-3, Section 6.8.

ExpectedEnergyAvailableExcludingExternal.description: Expected energy available excluding times of external or other outage causes per IEC 61724-3 Section 6.8.1.

MeasuredEnergyAvailableExcludingExternal.description: Actual energy available excluding times of external or other outage causes per IEC 61724-3 Section 6.8.1.

EnergyUnavailabilityComparison.description: Unavailability is a metric that quantifies the amount of energy lost when the system is not operating. This metric compares measured versus expected energy unavailability. This concepts reports the difference which is calculated as Measured  Expected.

EnergyUnavailabilityExcludingExternalOrO.description: Unavailability is a metric that quantifies the amount of energy lost when the system is not operating. This metric compares measured versus expected energy unavailability excluding times external or other outages. This concepts reports the difference which is calculated as Measured  Expected.

EnergyAvailabilityComparison.description: Comparison of measured versus expected energy availability. This concepts reports the difference which is calculated as Measured  Expected.

ActualOperationsAndMaintenanceCostPerWat.description: Actual cost of ownership for system based on documented expenses for the time period of the test in currency/W.

MeasurementClass.description: Measurement class per IEC 71724 where Class A is highest and Class C is lowest.

MeasurementUncertaintyBasisDescription.description: Description of standard method used to calculate uncertainity of measurement

MeterRevenueGrade.description: Indication as to whether the meter is revenue grade. If it is revenue grade, TRUE; if not revenue grade, FALSE.

MetStationDescriptionOfPyranometer.description: Description of the Pyranometer to measure solar radiation flux density.

MetStationLocation.description: Description of the location of the met station.

MetStationModelNumberOfPyranometer.description: Model number of Pyranometer to measure solar radiation flux density.

MinimumOutputGuaranteedPercent.description: Minimum percent of P50 expected energy production output guaranteed such that if output falls below that level, a refund will be made. For example, if output is guaranteed to be 98% or higher, the minimum threshhold is 98%. If output falls below 98%, a refund will be made.

MismatchModelFactorTMYPercent.description: Percentage of kWh lost due to module array mismatch, for a typical meteorogical year, calculation based on major design/energy production model used.

MismatchModelFactorTMMPercent.description: Percentage of kWh lost due to module array mismatch, for a typical meteorological month, calculation based on major design/energy production model used.

Model.description: Model number and name of the product.

ModelFactorsSoilingFlag.description: Indication if soiling is considered in the design model. If it is considered in the design model, TRUE; if it is not considered in the design model, FALSE.

ModelFactorsSnowFlag.description: Indication if snow is considered in the design model. If it is considered in the design model, TRUE; if it is not considered in the design model, FALSE.

ModelFactorsParasiticLossFlag.description: Indication if parasitic loss is considered in the design model. If it is considered in the design model, TRUE; if it is not considered in the design model, FALSE.

ModelFactorsExternalCurtailmentFlag.description: Indication if external curtailment is considered in the design model. If it is considered in the design model, TRUE; if it is not considered in the design model, FALSE.

ModelFactorsNonUnityPowerFactorFlag.description: Indication if non unity power factor is considered in the design model. If it is considered in the design model, TRUE; if it is not considered in the design model, FALSE.

ModelACSystemLoss.description: Expected annualized loss due to AC system efficiency based on major design/energy production model used.

ModelAmbientTemperature.description: Ambient temperature of the site on a given date based on major design/energy production model used. Can be reported as Celsius or Fahrenheit by the preparer when specifying units in the instance document.

ModelAvailabilityLoss.description: Expected annualized loss due to downtime of system and/or major components based on major design/energy production model used.

ModelAverageAmbientTemperature.description: Average Ambient temperature of the site over a given time period based on major design/energy production model used. Can be reported as Celsius or Fahrenheit by the preparer when specifying units in the instance document.

ModelClippingLoss.description: Expected annualized loss due to clipping at a maximum AC capacity (inverter or system clipping) based on major design/energy production model used.

ModelFirstYearModuleDegradationLoss.description: Expected annual DC capacity degradation on the module-level in the first year based on major design/energy production model used.

ModelFirstYearProjectDegradationLoss.description: Expected annual AC capacity degradation on the project-level in the first year based on major design/energy production model used.

ModelHorizonShadingLoss.description: Expected annualized loss due to horizon shading based on major design/energy production model used.

ModelImperfectInverterMaximumPowerPoint.description: Expected annualized loss due to inverter maximum power point tracking performance based on major design/energy production model used.

ModelIncidentAngleModifierLoss.description: Expected annualized loss due to irradiance incident angle on modules based on major design/energy production model used.

ModelInverterLoss.description: Expected annualized loss due to inverter efficiency based on major design/energy production model used.

ModelLowIrradianceLoss.description: Expected annualized loss due to low irradiance based on major design/energy production model used.

ModelModuleOrientationLoss.description: Expected annualized loss due to module orientation based on major design/energy production model used.

ModelModuleQualityLoss.description: Expected annualized loss due to real module capacity based on flash test results or assumed difference from nameplate capacity based on major design/energy production model used.

ModelOngoingModuleDegradationLossFactorM.description: Expected annualized DC capacity degradation on the module-level after the first year based on major design/energy production model used.

ModelOngoingProjectDegradationLoss.description: Expected annualized AC capacity degradation on the project-level after the first year based on major design/energy production model used.

ModelParasiticLoad.description: Energy consumed by the project, kWh per time period based on major design/energy production model used.

ModelReferenceCelIIrradiance.description: Irradiance of the reference cell (light sensor) used in the model.

ModelReferenceCellTemperature.description: Temperature of reference cell used for the model. Can be reported as Celsius or Fahrenheit by the preparer when specifying units in the instance document.

ModelRelativeHumidity.description: Relative humidity percent used for the model, which measures the current absolute humidity relative to the maximum for that temperature.

ModelTemperatureLossFactorModel.description: Expected annualized loss due to module temperature based on major design/energy production model used.

ModelWeatherSource.description: Weather source used for the model which can be None, Local, Satellite, Modeled, or Mixed.

ModuleAcceleratedAgeTestReportAgreementA.description: Indicates if the Module Accelerated Age Test Report is available. If it is available, TRUE; if it is not available, FALSE.
Indicates if there are exceptions to the Module Accelerated Age Test Report. If there are exceptions, TRUE; if there are no exceptions, FALSE.
Indicates if the Module Accelerated Age Test Report is available in final form. If it is available in fnal form, TRUE; if it is only available in draft form, FALSE.

ModuleAcceleratedAgeTestReportAgreementC.description: Names of counterparties to the Module Accelerated Age Test Report.

ModuleAcceleratedAgeTestReportAgreementE.description: Effective date of the Module Accelerated Age Test Report.
Description of any exceptions to the Module Accelerated Age Test Report.

ModuleAcceleratedAgeTestReportDocumentLi.description: Link to the Module Accelerated Age Test Report document.

ModuleAvailabilityOfStringLevelData.description: Availability of string level data, which refers to a feed of energy coming from a single panel. If string level data is available, TRUE; if not available, FALSE.

ModuleAveragePanelEfficiency.description: Manufacturers average percent efficiency rating by which the module can convert sunlight to power at Standard Test Conditions (STC). For example, 20% efficiency rating indicates that 80% of the sunlight that goes into the module is lost.

ModuleBackMaterial.description: Description of the material used on the back cover of the module.

ModuleBuiltInDCOptimizerAvailability.description: Indicates if the module has a built-in DC Optimizer, if it does, TRUE; if it does not, FALSE.

ModuleCellArea.description: Area of the cells on the module.

ModuleCellColumnCount.description: Number of columns of cells on a module.

ModuleCellCount.description: Number of cells on a module.

ModuleCellRowCount.description: Number of rows of cells on a module.

ModuleDesignFactor.description: Multiplier indicating the amount that the module can operate at above the nameplate capacity. For example at factor of 1.1, can safely operate 10% above the stated nameplate capacity rating.

ModuleFactoryAuditReportAvailabilityOfDo.description: Indicates if the module factory audit report  is available. If it is available, TRUE; if it is not available, FALSE.
Indicates if there are exceptions to the module factory audit report. If there are exceptions, TRUE; if there are no exceptions, FALSE.

ModuleFactoryAuditReportAvailabilityOfFi.description: Indicates if the module factory audit report  is available in final form. If it is available in fnal form, TRUE; if it is only available in draft form, FALSE.

ModuleFactoryAuditReportCounterpartiesTo.description: Names of counterparties to the module factory audit report.

ModuleFactoryAuditReportDocumentLink.description: Link to the Module Factory Audit Report document.

ModuleFactoryAuditReportEffectiveDate.description: Effective date of the module factory audit report.

ModuleFactoryAuditReportExceptionDescrip.description: Description of any exceptions to the module factory audit report.

ModuleFireRating.description: Description of the fire rating as classified by IEC 61730.

ModuleFlashTestCapacity.description: Measured capacity of the individual module, also known as the flash test capacity.

ModuleFrameMaterial.description: Description of the material used to build the frame or rating as classified by IP 67/IP 68.

ModuleFrontMaterialDescription.description: Description of the material used on the front cover of the module.

ModuleHasCertificationIEC60364-4-41.description: Module has Certification IEC60364-4-41, protection against electric shock. If it does, TRUE; if it does not, FALSE.

ModuleHasCertificationIEC61215.description: Module has Certification IEC61215/EN61215 IEC61215 Ed. 2, aging of PV modules. If it does, TRUE; if it does not, FALSE.

ModuleHasCertificationIEC61646.description: Module has Certification IEC61646, Thin-Film PV modules. If it does, TRUE; if it does not, FALSE.

ModuleHasCertificationIEC61701.description: Module has Certification IEC61701, salt mist corrosion resistance testing on PV modules. If it does, TRUE; if it does not, FALSE.

ModuleHasCertificationIEC61730.description: Module has Certification IEC61730/EN61730, safety qualifications. If it does, TRUE; if it does not, FALSE.

ModuleHasCertificationIEC62108.description: Module has Certification IEC62108, concentrator PV modules. If it does, TRUE; if it does not, FALSE.

ModuleHasCertificationIEC62716.description: Module has Certification IEC62716, amonia test. If it does, TRUE; if it does not, FALSE.

ModuleHasCertificationOther.description: Module has certification other than IEC60364-4-41, IEC61215, IEC61646, IEC61701, IEC61730, or IEC62108. If it does then list the certifications comma delimited.

ModuleHasCertificationUL1703.description: Module has certification UL1703, fire rating.  If it does, TRUE; if it does not, FALSE.

ModuleJunctionBoxRating.description: Description of the module Junction Box rating as classified in IP 67.

ModuleLevelPowerElectronicsHasMonitoring.description: Indication that the MLPE (module level power electronics) allows monitoring at the module level.

ModuleLevelPowerElectronicsHasOptimizati.description: Indication that the MLPE (module level power electronics) has a device that will dynamically optimize the voltage-current combination of a string to maximize power.

ModuleLevelPowerElectronicsHasRapidShutD.description: Indication that the MLPE (module level power electronics) has a device that provides module level rapid shutdown as a safety feature defined in NEC 2017.

ModuleLevelPowerElectronicsHasStringLeng.description: Indication that the MLPE (module level power electronics) allows a larger string length.

ModuleMaterialsAndWorkmanShipWarrantyIni.description: Initiation date of the Materials and Workmanship Warranty.

ModuleMaximumSeriesFuseRating.description: Maximum series fuse rating: rated capacity in amps of the largest fuse that can be used to support module strings.

ModuleMaximumVoltagePerIEC.description: Maximum amount of voltage that can be safely handled by the module, determined by IEC (International Electrotechnical Commission).

ModuleMaximumVoltagePerUL.description: Maximum amount of voltage that can be safely handled by the module, determined by UL.

ModuleMicroInverterAvailability.description: Indicates if the module has a microinverter, if it does, TRUE; if it does not, FALSE.

ModuleNameplateCapacity.description: Nameplate capacity (nominal power) of the module  estimate set by the manufacturer for all modules of that type. Measured in Watts.

ModuleOpenCircuitVoltage.description: The amount of DC voltage the cell, module or string will generate with no load (zero current being delivered).

ModuleOperatingTemperatureMaximum.description: Maximum operating temperature of the solar module. Can be reported as Celsius or Fahrenheit by the preparer when specifying units in the instance document.

ModuleOperatingTemperatureMinimum.description: Minimum operating temperature of the solar module. Can be reported as Celsius or Fahrenheit by the preparer when specifying units in the instance document.

ModuleOrientation.description: Orientation of the module which can be portrait or landscape.

ModulePerformanceWarrantyEndDate.description: Date performance warranty expires. The performance warranty guarantees that a solar panel will operate with a given level of efficiency over its lifetime.

ModulePerformanceWarrantyGuaranteedOutpu.description: Description of the amount of production guaranteed by a solar panel performance warranty, which will guarantee a percentage of production depending on the age of the module. For example, guarantees 80% production after 25 years.

ModulePerformanceWarrantyType.description: Description of the type of module performance warranty. For example, duration of the warranty, guaranteed output.

ModulePowerToleranceRangeMaximum.description: Maximum percent tolerance between nameplate (nominal) power and flash test capacity of the module, on average.

ModulePowerToleranceRangeMinimum.description: Minimum percent tolerance between nameplate (nominal) power and flash test capacity of the module, on average.

ModuleProductWarrantyEndDate.description: Date when the product warranty expires for the panels.

ModuleProductWarrantyTerm.description: Duration of the product warranty term offered by the manufacturer in the format P1Y1M1D.

ModuleRatedCurrent.description: Value of the current when module is operating at maximum power. May also be called Maximum Power Current.

ModuleRatedVoltage.description: Value of the voltage when module is operating at maximum power.  May also be called Maximum Power Voltage.

ModuleShortCircuitCurrent.description: Amount of current going through the cell, module or string when the voltage is zero.

ModulesPerString.description: Number of modules that comprise a single string within the sub array, a single unit of modules mounted together and set at the same angle and orientation.

ModuleIsBIPV.description: Indicates if the module is Building Integrated PV, which means that photovoltaic materials are used to replace conventional building materials in parts of the building envelope such as the roof, skylights, or facades.

ModuleTemperature.description: Temperature of the PV module at a point in time. Can be reported as Celsius or Fahrenheit by the preparer when specifying units in the instance document.

ModuleTemperatureCoefficientMaximumCurre.description: Amount of decrease in maximum current as temperature increases, measured in percent per Celsius. May also be known as ?Ipmax.

ModuleTemperatureCoefficientMaximumPower.description: Amount of decrease in power output as temperature increases, measured in percent per Celsius. May also be known as ?Pmax.

ModuleTemperatureCoefficientOperatingVol.description: Amount of decrease in voltage output as temperature increases, measured in percent per Celsius. May also be known as ?Voc.

ModuleTemperatureCoefficientShortCircuit.description: Amount of decrease in current output as temperature increases, measured in percent per Celsius. May also be known as ?Isc.

ModuleTemperatureCoefficientMaximumVolta.description: Amount of decrease in maximum voltage as temperature increases, measured in percent per Celsius. May also be known as ?Vpmax.

MonitoringContractAvailabilityOfDocument.description: Indicates if the Monitoring Contract is available. If it is available, TRUE; if it is not available, FALSE.
Indicates if there are exceptions to the Monitoring Contract. If there are exceptions, TRUE; if there are no exceptions, FALSE.

MonitoringContractAvailabilityOfFinalDoc.description: Indicates if the Monitoring Contract is available in final form. If it is available in fnal form, TRUE; if it is only available in draft form, FALSE.

MonitoringContractCounterparties.description: Names of counterparties to the Monitoring Contract.

MonitoringContractCounterparty.description: Counterparty to the Monitoring Contract between the project company and engineering company to monitor system performance.

MonitoringContractDocumentLink.description: Link to the Monitoring Contract document.

MonitoringContractExceptionDescription.description: Description of any exceptions to the Monitoring Contract.

MonitoringContractExpirationDate.description: Expiration date of the Monitoring Contract between the project company and engineering company to monitor system performance.

MonitoringContractInitiationDate.description: Initiation date of the Monitoring Contract between the project company and engineering company to monitor system performance.

MonitoringContractRate.description: Rate in currency per kWh of the Monitoring Contract between the project company and engineering company to monitor system performance.

MonitoringContractRateEscalator.description: Percent escalator in the Monitoring Contract between the project company and engineering company to monitor system performance.

MonitoringContractRateType.description: Description of the Monitoring Contract rate type defined in the Monitoring Contract between the project company and engineering company to monitor system performance.

MonitoringContractTerm.description: Term of the  Monitoring Contract between the project company and engineering company to monitor system performance. The value should be entered using the ISO8601 format of PnY or PnM. For example, a 5 year term would be represented as P5Y, a 3 month term as P3M.

MonitoringSolutionSoftwareVersion.description: Version number of application software of the monitoring solution.

MonthlyOperatingReportLevel.description: Indicates if the Monthly Operating Report is at the Site Level, Fund Level, or Project Level.

MonthlyOperatingReportAvailabilityOfDocu.description: Indicates if the Monthly Operating Report is available. If it is available, TRUE; if it is not available, FALSE.
Indicates if there are exceptions to the Monthly Operating Report or issues raised. If there are exceptions, TRUE; if there are no exceptions, FALSE.

MonthlyOperatingReportAvailabilityOfFina.description: Indicates if the Monthly Operating Report is available in final form. If it is available in fnal form, TRUE; if it is only available in draft form, FALSE.

MonthlyOperatingReportCounterparties.description: Names of counterparties to the Monthly Operating Report, which documents monthly statistics on insolation, energy, availability and performance.

MonthlyOperatingReportDocumentLink.description: Link to the Monthly Operating Report document.

MonthlyOperatingReportEffectiveDate.description: Effective date of the Monthly Operating Report, which documents monthly statistics on insolation, energy, availability and performance.

MonthlyOperatingReportExceptionDescripti.description: Description of any exceptions to the Monthly Operating Report or issues raised.

MonthlyOperatingReportEndDate.description: End date of the Monthly Operating Report, which documents monthly statistics on insolation, energy, availability and performance.

MonthlyOperatingReportMaterialNonRoutine.description: Description of material non-routine maintenance in the Monthly Operating Report

MonthlyOperatingReportOverview.description: Description of project overview in the Monthly Operating Report

MonthlyOperatingReportPreparerName.description: Name of the company or individual that prepared the monthly operating report.

MonthlyOperatingReportRegulatoryMattersC.description: Description of regulatory matters, curtailment and transmission issues in the Monthly Operating Report

MonthlyOperatingReportRoutinePreventativ.description: Description of routine preventative maintenance in the Monthly Operating Report

MonthlyOperatingReportWarrantyManagement.description: Description of warranty management in the Monthly Operating Report

PeriodOfApplicableDistribution.description: Period for which the cash distribution is made, for example the month of January, or the 2nd quarter.

PartnersCapitalAccountReturnOfCapital.description: Total change in each class of partners' capital accounts during the year due to the return of partner's capital. That is, excess distributions over earnings to partners. All partners include general, limited and preferred partners.

CashAndCashEquivalentsAtCarryingValue.description: Amount of currency on hand as well as demand deposits with banks or financial institutions. Includes other kinds of accounts that have the general characteristics of demand deposits. Also includes short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates. Excludes cash and cash equivalents within disposal group and discontinued operation.

AccountsReceivableNet.description: For an unclassified balance sheet, the amount due from customers or clients for goods or services that have been delivered or sold in the normal course of business, reduced to their estimated net realizable fair value by an allowance established by the entity of the amount it deems uncertain of collection.

PrepaidExpenseCurrentAndNoncurrent.description: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of expenditures made in advance of when the economic benefit of the cost will be realized, and which will be expensed in future periods with the passage of time or when a triggering event occurs.

AssetsSolarFacilities.description: Amount of assets classified as solar facilities.

Assets.description: Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date of all assets that are recognized. Assets are probable future economic benefits obtained or controlled by an entity as a result of past transactions or events.

AccountsPayableAndAccruedLiabilitiesCurr.description: Sum of the carrying values as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred through that date, including liabilities incurred and payable to vendors for goods and services received, taxes, interest, rent and utilities, compensation costs, payroll taxes and fringe benefits (other than pension and postretirement obligations), contractual rights and obligations, and statutory obligations.

DueToRelatedPartiesCurrentAndNoncurrent.description: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of obligations due all related parties.

DeferredRentCredit.description: The cumulative difference between the rental payments required by a lease agreement and the rental income or expense recognized on a straight-line basis, or other systematic and rational basis more representative of the time pattern in which use or benefit is granted or derived from the leased property, expected to be recognized in income or expense over the term of the leased property by the lessor or lessee, respectively.

AssetRetirementObligation.description: The carrying amount of a liability for an asset retirement obligation. An asset retirement obligation is a legal obligation associated with the disposal or retirement of a tangible long-lived asset that results from the acquisition, construction or development, or the normal operations of a long-lived asset, except for certain obligations of lessees.

Liabilities.description: Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date of all liabilities that are recognized. Liabilities are probable future sacrifices of economic benefits arising from present obligations of an entity to transfer assets or provide services to other entities in the future.

LiabilitiesAndStockholdersEquity.description: Amount of liabilities and equity items, including the portion of equity attributable to noncontrolling interests, if any.

Revenues.description: Amount of revenue recognized from goods sold, services rendered, insurance premiums, or other activities that constitute an earning process. Includes, but is not limited to, investment and interest income before deduction of interest expense when recognized as a component of revenue, and sales and trading gain (loss).

OperatingLeaseExpense.description: Amount of operating lease expense. Excludes sublease income.

OtherCostAndExpenseOperating.description: The total amount of other operating cost and expense items that are associated with the entity's normal revenue producing operation.

GeneralAndAdministrativeExpense.description: The aggregate total of expenses of managing and administering the affairs of an entity, including affiliates of the reporting entity, which are not directly or indirectly associated with the manufacture, sale or creation of a product or product line.

Depreciation.description: The amount of expense recognized in the current period that reflects the allocation of the cost of tangible assets over the assets' useful lives. Includes production and non-production related depreciation.

AccretionExpense.description: Amount recognized for the passage of time, typically for liabilities, that have been discounted to their net present values. Excludes accretion associated with asset retirement obligations.

NoninterestIncome.description: The total amount of noninterest income which may be derived from: (1) fees and commissions; (2) premiums earned; (3) insurance policy charges; (4) the sale or disposal of assets; and (5) other sources not otherwise specified.

InterestIncomeExpenseNet.description: The net amount of operating interest income (expense).

NetIncomeLoss.description: The portion of profit or loss for the period, net of income taxes, which is attributable to the parent.

OperatingExpenses.description: Generally recurring costs associated with normal operations except for the portion of these expenses which can be clearly related to production and included in cost of sales or services. Includes selling, general and administrative expense.

AccountsReceivableGross.description: For unclassified balance sheet, amounts due from customers or clients for goods or services that have been delivered or sold in the normal course of business.

MountingType.description: Mounting type of the array which can be Ballasted, Attached, BIPV, or Pole/Pier.

NaturalResourceIdentified.description: Description of the natural resource identified.

NaturalResourceIdentifiedLocation.description: Description of the location of the natural resource.

NaturalResourceIdentifiedName.description: Name of the natural resource identified.

NaturalResourceLocation.description: Description of the location where the natural resource was identified.

CulturalResourcePermitAction.description: Identifier, name, or title of action required by the cultural resources permit.

NaturalResourcePermitAction.description: Identifier, name, or title of action required by the natural resources permit.

NaturalResourcePermitActionDescription.description: Description of action required by the natural resources permit, for example, a fee or covenant.

NaturalResourcePermitIdentifier.description: Identifier for the natural resource permit.

NaturalResourcePermitGoverningAuthority.description: Name of the governing authority that issued the permit.

NaturalResourcePermitIdentification.description: Identifier for the natural resource permit associated with a particular action.

NaturalResourcePermitIssueDate.description: Date on which the natural resource permit was issued.

NaturalResourcePermitLink.description: Link to the permit for the natural resource.

NaturalResourceStudyAction.description: Description of action suggested in the natural resource study.

NetworkType.description: Type of internet connection to system.

NonUnityPowerModelFactorTMYPercent.description: Percentage of kWh lost due to operating at non-unity power factor (note: unity power factor should equal 1.0; operating at 0.9 or 1.1 would result in loss of energy or not enough energy produced.), for a typical meteorological year, calculation based on major design/energy production model used.

NonUnityPowerModelFactorTMMPercent.description: Percentage of kWh lost due to operating at non-unity power factor (note: unity power factor should equal 1.0; operating at 0.9 or 1.1 would result in loss of energy or not enough energy produced.), for a typical meteorological met month, calculation based on major design/energy production model used.

NoticeAndPaymentInstructionsAvailability.description: Indicates if the Notice and Payment Instructions is available. If it is available, TRUE; if it is not available, FALSE.
Indicates if there are exceptions to the Notice and Payment Instructions. If there are exceptions, TRUE; if there are no exceptions, FALSE.
Indicates if the Notice and Payment Instructions is available in final form. If it is available in fnal form, TRUE; if it is only available in draft form, FALSE.

NoticeAndPaymentInstructionsCounterparti.description: Names of counterparties to the Notice and Payment Instructions.

NoticeAndPaymentInstructionsEffectiveDat.description: Effective date of the Notice and Payment Instructions.

NoticeAndPaymentInstructionsExceptionDes.description: Description of any exceptions to the Notice and Payment Instructions.

NoticeAndPaymentInstructionsExpirationDa.description: Expiration date of the Notice and Payment Instructions.

NoticeAndPaymentInstructionsLink.description: Link to the Notice And Payment Instructions document.

NoticeOfApprovalAvailabilityOfDocument.description: Indicates if the notice of approval is available. If it is available, TRUE; if it is not available, FALSE.

NoticeOfApprovalAvailabilityOfExceptions.description: Indicates if there are exceptions to the notice of approval. If there are exceptions, TRUE; if there are no exceptions, FALSE.

NoticeOfApprovalAvailabilityOfFinalDocum.description: Indicates if the notice of approval is available in final form. If it is available in fnal form, TRUE; if it is only available in draft form, FALSE.

NoticeOfApprovalCounterparties.description: Names of counterparties to the notice of approval.

NoticeOfApprovalDocumentLink.description: Link to the Notice Of Approval document.

NoticeOfApprovalEffectiveDate.description: Effective date of the notice of approval.

NoticeOfApprovalExceptionsDescription.description: Description of any exceptions to the notice of approval.

NoticeOfApprovalExpirationDate.description: Expiration date of the notice of approval.

NoticeOfCommercialOperationAvailabilityO.description: Indicates if the Notice of Commercial Operation is available. If it is available, TRUE; if it is not available, FALSE.
Indicates if there are exceptions to the Notice of Commercial Operation. If there are exceptions, TRUE; if there are no exceptions, FALSE.
Indicates if the Notice of Commercial Operation is available in final form. If it is available in fnal form, TRUE; if it is only available in draft form, FALSE.

NoticeOfCommercialOperationCounterpartie.description: Names of counterparties to the Notice of Commercial Operation.

NoticeOfCommercialOperationDocumentLink.description: Link to the Notice Of Commercial Operation document.

NoticeOfCommercialOperationEffectiveDate.description: Effective date of the Notice of Commercial Operation.

NoticeOfCommercialOperationExceptionDesc.description: Description of any exceptions to the Notice of Commercial Operation.

NoticeOfCommercialOperationExpirationDat.description: Expiration date of the Notice of Commercial Operation.

NoticeOfCommercialOperationsDateAvailabi.description: Indicates if the Notice of Commercial Operations Date is available. If it is available, TRUE; if it is not available, FALSE.
Indicates if there are exceptions to the Notice of Commercial Operations Date or issues raised. If there are exceptions, TRUE; if there are no exceptions, FALSE.
Indicates if the Notice of Commercial Operations Date is available in final form. If it is available in fnal form, TRUE; if it is only available in draft form, FALSE.

NoticeOfCommercialOperationsDateCounterp.description: Names of counterparties to the Notice of Commercial Operations Date.

NoticeOfCommercialOperationsDateEffectiv.description: Effective date of the Notice of Commercial Operations Date.

NoticeOfCommercialOperationsDateExceptio.description: Description of any exceptions to the Notice of Commercial Operations Date or issues raised.

NoticeOfCommercialOperationsDocumentLink.description: Link to the Notice Of Commercial Operations document.

OfftakerIdentifier.description: Used as the identifier for the OffTaker.

CreditPerformanceDateOfFICOScore.description: Date of the FICO score for an OffTaker.

OneYearInPlaneAssumedIrradiation.description: One-year in-plane assumed irradiation, Hi, as described in IEC 61724-1 Ed. 2, in kWh/m2.

OneYearInPlaneMeasuredIrradiation.description: One-year in-plane measured irradiation, Hi, as described in IEC 61724-1 Ed. 2, in kWh/m2.

SystemIrradiationWeatherAdjustmentFactor.description: Ratio between expected (assumed) one year in-plane measured irradiation and actual one year in-plane measured irradiation.

OperatingAgreementsForMasterLesseeLessee.description: Indicates if the Operating Agreements for Master Lessee, Lessee and Operator is available. If it is available, TRUE; if it is not available, FALSE.
Indicates if there are exceptions to the Operating Agreements for Master Lessee, Lessee and Operator or issues raised. If there are exceptions, TRUE; if there are no exceptions, FALSE.
Indicates if the Operating Agreements for Master Lessee, Lessee and Operator is available in final form. If it is available in fnal form, TRUE; if it is only available in draft form, FALSE.
Names of counterparties to the Operating Agreements for Master Lessee, Lessee and Operator.
Link to the Operating Agreements For Master Lessee, Lessee And Operator document.
Effective date of the Operating Agreements for Master Lessee, Lessee and Operator.
Description of any exceptions to the Operating Agreements for Master Lessee, Lessee and Operator or issues raised.
Expiration date of the Operating Agreements for Master Lessee, Lessee and Operator.

OperatingLeasesRentExpenseNet.description: Rental expense for the reporting period incurred under operating leases, including minimum and any contingent rent expense, net of related sublease income.

OperationalAccessDescription.description: Description of how to access site, for example where to obtain keys to the site.

OperationalCombinationLockPasswordInvert.description: Password and login id for combination lock for installation and for equipment.

FinancialCommunicationsExpense.description: Communications expense which is typically the monthly telephone bill.

OperationalCompanyResponsibleForRepair.description: Name of company responsible for repairing or maintaining a specific piece of equipment.

OperationalDistanceNearestOwnedPVSystem.description: Distance to nearest PV system project that has the same ownership, for example in miles.

OperationalEarthquakeInsurance.description: Amount of earthquake insurance in currency per nominal power (kWdc) which is defined as the nameplate capacity of the PV system.

FinancialElectricityCost.description: Grid electricity cost in currency per kWh.

FinancialElectricityExpense.description: Cost of electricity from the utility.

OperationalIssuesDateAndTimeIssueCommenc.description: Start time and date of individual issue.

OperationalIssuesDateAndTimeProductionRe.description: Date and time production resumed after individual issue resolved.

OperationalIssuesDateAndTimeProductionSt.description: Date and time production stopped to resolve reported issue

OperationalIssuesFutureSteps.description: Information related to an issue covering future steps to be taken on the issue.

OperationalIssuesImpactOfIssue.description: Description of information related to an issue and impact of the issue.

OperationalIssuesEnergyLossDueToIssue.description: Amount of energy lost due to operational system issue.

OperationalReportingSeverityOfMajorEvent.description: Level of severity of the major operational event, which can be Low, Moderate, or High.

OperationalIssuesLengthofIssue.description: Number of days the issue takes to be resolved.

OperationalIssuesPlanOfAction.description: Information related to an issue covering plan of action to be taken on the issue.

OperationalIssuesReportedIssueDescriptio.description: Description of reported issue that requires resolution.

FinancialPerformanceActualIncentivesToEx.description: Computed average energy production for the three month period of July, August, and September over all years of operation since Activation Date (in kWh).

OptimizerMaximumEfficiency.description: Maximum percent efficiency rating of the optimizer.

OptimizerMaximumInputCurrent.description: Maximum amount of current that the optimizer can safely draw.

OptimizerMaximumInputVoltage.description: Maximum rated voltage of the optimizer.Maximum rated voltage of the optimizer. Absolute maximum input voltage Voc at the lowest temperature according to NEC.

OptimizerMaximumOutputCurrent.description: Maximum amount of current that the optimizer can output.

OptimizerMaximumOutputVoltage.description: Maximum voltage that the optimizer can output.

OptimizerMaximumShortCircuitCurrent.description: This is the maximum input current, based on PV module, that the optimizer can handle.

OptimizerMaximumSystemVoltage.description: Maximum system DC voltage that the optimizer can support.

OptimizerMPPTOperatingRangeVoltageMaximu.description: Optimizer Maximum Power Point Tracking maximum operating voltage range.

OptimizerMPPTOperatingRangeVoltageMinimu.description: Optimizer Maximum Power Point Tracking minimum operating voltage range.

OptimizerRatedInputPower.description: Rated input power of the optimizer.

OptimizerServiceability.description: Description of the level of serviceability of the optimizer, for example, a stand-alone unit that can be easily replaced, a unit attached to a module that may be replaced in the field (although not all of them can be), an embedded device that cannot be serviced separate from the module.

OptimizerType.description: Physical type of optimizer which can be stand-alone, attached to a module, embedded in the module or other.

OptimizerWeightedEfficiency.description: Measured efficiency under test conditions equal to California Energy Commission (CEC) test conditions.

OrientationAzimuth.description: Azimuth of the sun, measured in degrees. The horizontal angle measured clockwise from true north, e.g. True North = 0 degrees, East = 90 degrees, South = 180 degrees, etc.

OrientationGroundCoverageRatio.description:
The ratio of the photovoltaic array area to the total ground area. For an array configured in rows of modules, the GCR is the length of the side of one row divided by the distance between the bottom of one row and the bottom of its neighboring row. An array with a low ground coverage ratio (closer to zero) has rows spaced further apart than an array with a high ground coverage ratio (closer to 1).
The ground coverage ratio must be a value greater than 0.01 and less than 0.99.

OrientationTilt.description: The array's tilt angle in degrees from horizontal, where zero degrees is horizontal, and 90 degrees is vertical and facing the equator (in both the southern and northern hemispheres)

OrientationMaximumTrackerRotationLimit.description: Maximum (positive) angle of rotation from the vertical plane (at zero degrees) clockwise about the horizontal axis when observed from the equator for north south oriented single axis trackers or from the easterly direction for dual axis trackers or east west oriented single axis trackers.

OrientationMinimumTrackerRotationLimit.description: Minimum (negative) angle of rotation from the vertical plane (at zero degrees) clockwise about the axis when observed from the equator for north south oriented single axis trackers or from the easterly direction for dual axis trackers or east west oriented single axis trackers.

The value should be entered using the ISO8601 format of PnYnMnDTnHnMnS. ParasiticLossModelFactorTMMPercent.description: Percentage of kWh lost due to annualized Parasitic Energy loss (inverters, trackers, etc.) for a typical meteorological month, calculation based on major design/energy production model used.

PartnershipFlipDate.description: Date on which the investor's target return has been reached, also called the flip point.

PartnershipFlipExpirationDate.description: Date on which the Partnership Flip or group of Partnership Flips is set to expire, in CCYY-MM-DD format.

The value should be entered using the ISO8601 format of PnYnMnDTnHnMnS. For example, a 5-year term would be represented as P5Y, a 3-month term as P3M, and a 4-year, 6-month and 10-day term would be represented as P4Y6M10D.

PartnershipFlipP50FlipDate.description: Date of the partnership flip when the annual energy output is a P50 yield.

PartnershipFlipP75FlipDate.description: Date of the partnership flip when the annual energy output is a P75 yield.

PartnershipFlipP75FlipPeriod.description: Expected flip period for the partnership based on a P75 yield. The value should be entered using the ISO8601 format of PnYnMnDTnHnMnS. For example, a 5-year term would be represented as P5Y, a 3-month term as P3M, and a 4-year, 6-month and 10-day term would be represented as P4Y6M10D.

PartnershipFlipP90FlipDate.description: Date of the partnership flip when the annual energy output is a P90 yield.

PartnershipFlipP90FlipPeriod.description: Expected flip period for the partnership based on a P90 yield. The value should be entered using the ISO8601 format of PnYnMnDTnHnMnS. For example, a 5-year term would be represented as P5Y, a 3-month term as P3M, and a 4-year, 6-month and 10-day term would be represented as P4Y6M10D.

PartnershipFlipP95FlipDate.description: Date of the partnership flip when the annual energy output is a P95 yield.

PartnershipFlipP95FlipPeriod.description: Expected flip period for the partnership based on a P95 yield. The value should be entered using the ISO8601 format of PnYnMnDTnHnMnS. For example, a 5-year term would be represented as P5Y, a 3-month term as P3M, and a 4-year, 6-month and 10-day term would be represented as P4Y6M10D.

PartnershipFlipP99FlipDate.description: Date of the partnership flip when the annual energy output is a P99 yield.

PartnershipFlipP99FlipPeriod.description: Expected flip period for the partnership based on a P99 yield. The value should be entered using the ISO8601 format of PnYnMnDTnHnMnS. For example, a 5-year term would be represented as P5Y, a 3-month term as P3M, and a 4-year, 6-month and 10-day term would be represented as P4Y6M10D.

PartnershipFlipTermOfContract.description: Contract term of the partnership flip. The value should be entered using the ISO8601 format of PnYnMnDTnHnMnS. For example, a 5-year term would be represented as P5Y, a 3-month term as P3M, and a 4-year, 6-month and 10-day term would be represented as P4Y6M10D.

PartnershipFlipYield.description: Required target return of the investor, at which point the partnership allocation would flip.

PaymentServicingACHPayment.description: Indicates whether ACH payment capability has been set up; if it has, TRUE; if it has not, FALSE.

PaymentServicingACHPaymentDiscountPercen.description: Amount of ACH payment discount as a percentage.

PaymentServicingAnnualEscalatorforLeaseP.description: Annual escalator percent increase compounded per year, calculated at project in-service date or date first monthly payment is due.

PaymentServicingBaseLeasePayment.description: Amount of the base lease payment, initial payment prior to escalation.

PaymentServicingFirstPaymentDate.description: First payment date of the system.

PaymentServicingInsurancePaymentReceived.description: Amount of the insurance payment received.

PaymentServicingLastPaymentDate.description: Date of the last payment to be made on the lease.

PaymentServicingLeaseEscalatorEndDate.description: Date after which there can be no escalation in the lease payment.

PaymentServicingLeaseEscalatorStartDate.description: Date at which lease escalator goes into effect.

PaymentServicingLeaseInitialMonthlyPayme.description: Amount of the initial monthly lease payment.

PaymentServicingLeasePrepaid.description: Amount of total lease payments made upfront as percentage of total lease payments for the life of the lease.

PaymentServicingLeasePrepaidAmount.description: Amount of total lease payments made upfront.

PaymentServicingNextPaymentDate.description: Date when the next lease payment is to be made.

PaymentServicingNextRateAdjustmentDate.description: Next date when the rate is expected to be adjusted, for example, when the escalator will go into effect.

OfftakerProjectedElectricSavingstoUtilit.description: Initial monthly savings projected to be received by the utility for first year as amount per kilowatt hour.
Initial monthly savings the utility is expected to receive for first year based as the percentage cost difference per kilowatt hour.

PerformanceBasedIncentiveRevenue.description: Performance Based Incentive (PBI) Revenue from the State of California. Is a rebate program based on the performance of the system.

PerformanceGuaranteeDescription.description: Description of the Performance guarantee, which is provided by the operator or developer to guarantee a certain level of operating performance.

PerformanceGuaranteeDocumentLink.description: Link to the Performance Guarantee document.

PerformanceGuaranteeEffectiveDate.description: Effective date of the Performance guarantee, which is provided by the operator or developer to guarantee a certain level of operating performance.

PerformanceGuaranteeExpirationDate.description: Expiration date of the Performance guarantee, which is provided by the operator or developer to guarantee a certain level of operating performance.

PerformanceGuaranteeExclusions.description: Description of exclusions in the Performance guarantee, which is provided by the operator or developer to guarantee a certain level of operating performance.

PerformanceGuaranteeLiquidatedDamages.description: Amount of liquidated damages in the Performance guarantee, which is provided by the operator or developer to guarantee a certain level of operating performance.

PerformanceGuaranteeProvider.description: Name of operator or developer providing the Performance guarantee, which is provided to guarantee a certain level of operating performance.

PerformanceGuaranteeTerm.description: Term of the Performance guarantee, which is provided by the operator or developer to guarantee a certain level of operating performance. The value should be entered using the ISO8601 format of PnYnMnDTnHnMnS. For example, a 5-year term would be represented as P5Y, a 3-month term as P3M, and a 4-year, 6-month and 10-day term would be represented as P4Y6M10D.

PerformanceModelModifiedFlag.description: Indication as to whether the performance model has been modified relative to the previous test completed. If it has been modified, TRUE; if it has not been modified, FALSE.

PerformanceRatioMethodology.description: Description of the methodology used to calculate the performance ratio which could be IECRE or another method.

PerformanceRatioNonWeatherCorrected.description: Performance ratio, non-weather corrected, percent, calculated per IEC 61724-3.

PerformanceRatioWeatherCorrected.description: Performance ratio, weather corrected, percent, calculated per IEC 61724-3.

PeriodicBudgetNumberforthePeriod.description: Number of the time period, for example 1 may represent the first quarter of the year.

OperationalPerformanceDowntime.description: Number of hours of inverter downtime.

PermissionToOperateInterconnectionApprov.description: Indicates if there are exceptions to the Permission To Operate Interconnection Approval or issues raised. If there are exceptions, TRUE; if there are no exceptions, FALSE.
Indicates if the Permission To Operate Interconnection Approval document is available. If it is available in fnal form, TRUE; if it is only available in draft form, FALSE.

PhaseOfProjectNeeded.description: Phase of the project which can be pre-construction, early construction, periodic throughout construction, upon initial funding (Mechanical Completion) or upon final funding (Substantial or Final Completion).

PledgeAgreementExpirationDate.description: Expiration date of the Pledge Agreement.

PledgeAgreementLink.description: Link to the Pledge Agreement document.

PortfolioLegalEntity.description: Legal entity identify for the portfolio company.

PortfolioLevelDebt.description: Indicates if there is portfolio level debt. If there is debt, TRUE; if there is no debt, FALSE.

PortfolioLevelLegalEntity.description: Indicates if there is a legal entity at the portfolio level. If there is a legal entity, TRUE; if there is no legal entity, FALSE.

PortfolioNumberOfSystems.description: Nubmer of systems in the portfolio.

PortfolioUsedInFund.description: Indicates if the portfolio is included as part of the fund. If it is used, TRUE; if it is not used, FALSE.

PostClosePostClosingItems.description: Description of outstanding issues that must be resolved after the project has been funded.

PostClosePunchListItems.description: Description of post-close punch list items.

PowerPerformanceIndex.description: Ratio of measured to targeted power per IEC 61724-2, section 6.4.

PowerPurchaseAgreementContractTermsBuyou.description: Description of buyout options in the Power Purchase Agreement.

PowerPurchaseAgreementContractTermsCurta.description: Description of curtailment provisions of the Power Purchase Agreement.

PowerPurchaseAgreementContractTermsDateO.description: Date of contract expiration of long-term contract to purchase electricity from a production system, e.g., could be same as  PPA Expiration Date.
Date of contract initiation of long-term contract to purchase electricity from a production system. (Asset mgmt and transaction/trade), e.g., could be the same as PPA Effective Date.

The value should be entered using the ISO8601 format of PnYnMnDTnHnMnS. For example, a 5-year term would be represented as P5Y, a 3-month term as P3M, and a 4-year, 6-month and 10-day term would be represented as P4Y6M10D.

PowerPurchaseAgreementContractTermsPayme.description: The time interval at which lease payments are to be made to the system owner, for example, monthly, quarterly, annually.

PowerPurchaseAgreementContractTermsPower.description: Description of Power Offtake Agreement in the Power Purchase Agreement.

PowerPurchaseAgreementContractTermsPPAAm.description: Execution date of the Power Purchase Agreement Amendment.

PowerPurchaseAgreementContractTermsPPACo.description: Counterparty to the Power Purchase Agreement.

PowerPurchaseAgreementContractTermsPPAFi.description: Guaranteed volume of energy to be delivered by the Project Company under the terms of the Power Purchase Agreement in kWh.

PowerPurchaseAgreementContractTermsPPAGu.description: Output guaranteed in the Power Purchase Agreement in kWh.

PowerPurchaseAgreementContractTermsPPAPe.description: Performance guarantee output as percent of P50 energy production.

Power Purchase Agreement Performance Guarantee Initiation Date

Term of the performance guarantee. The value should be entered using the ISO8601 format of PnYnMnDTnHnMnS. For example, a 5-year term would be represented as P5Y, a 3-month term as P3M, and a 4-year, 6-month and 10-day term would be represented as P4Y6M10D.
Description of the type of performance guarantee.

PowerPurchaseAgreementContractTermsPPAPo.description: Percentage of site based on units per the Power Purchase Agreement.
Number of units used to measure power system capacity for Power Purchase Agreement.

PowerPurchaseAgreementContractTermsPPATe.description: Term of the Power Purchase Agreement. The value should be entered using the ISO8601 format of PnYnMnDTnHnMnS. For example, a 5-year term would be represented as P5Y, a 3-month term as P3M, and a 4-year, 6-month and 10-day term would be represented as P4Y6M10D.

PowerPurchaseAgreementContractAdditional.description: The number of additional terms allowed in the Power Purchase Agreement, beyond the initial term. For example, the PPA may allow two additional terms of five years each. The value two should be entered as an integer.

Duration of additional terms allowed in the Power Purchase Agreement, beyond the initial term. For example, the PPA may allow two additional terms of five years each. The value, five years, should be entered using the ISO8601 format of PnYnMnDTnHnMnS. For example, a 5-year term would be represented as P5Y, a 3-month term as P3M, and a 4-year, 6-month and 10-day term would be represented as P4Y6M10D.

PowerPurchaseAgreementPurchaserOptionToP.description: Description of purchaser option to purchase the system, as described in the Power Purchase Agreement.

PowerPurchaseAgreementContractTermsProdu.description: Amount of energy (kWh) guaranteed to be generated by the installation in the Power Purchase Agreement.

PowerPurchaseAgreementContractTermsProvi.description: Name of project company or developer (organization that produces energy) in the Power Purchase Agreement.

PowerPurchaseAgreementContractTermsRenew.description: Amount of Renewable Energy Credits sold to off-taker when electricity sold to off taker includes the Renewable Energy Credits so the off taker can take advantage of the credit.

PowerPurchaseAgreementContractTermsSiteL.description: Confirmation of the availability of the Site Lease Agreement per the Power Purchase Agreement Agreement. If available, TRUE; if not available, FALSE.

PowerPurchaseAgreementContractTermsSpeci.description: Description of special customer rights and obligations in the Power Purchase Agreement.
Description of special features in the Power Purchase Agreement.
Description of special provider rights and obligations in the Power Purchase Agreement.

PowerPurchaseAgreementContractTermsTermi.description: Description of termination rights of all parties to the transaction in the Power Purchase Agreement.

PowerPurchaseAgreementContractTermsTrans.description: Description of transmission and scheduling responsibilities in the Power Purchase Agreement.

PowerPurchaseAgreementDescription.description: Description of the Power Purchase Agreement.

PowerPurchaseAgreementRateActualAmount.description: Power Purchase Agreement Actual revenue generated.

PowerPurchaseAgreementRateAddressForInvo.description: Address for Power Purchase Agreement off taker.

PowerPurchaseAgreementRateAmountActualTo.description: Power Purchase Agreement Actual revenue generated from inception to date.

PowerPurchaseAgreementRateCompanyInvoice.description: Name of company where the Power Purchase Agreement invoice is sent.

PowerPurchaseAgreementRateContactAddress.description: Address where notices regarding activities related to the Power Purchase Agreement are sent.

PowerPurchaseAgreementRateContactEmailTo.description: Email address for contact individual for Power Purchase Agreement notices.

PowerPurchaseAgreementRateContactToRecei.description: Contact individual for Power Purchase Agreement notices.

PowerPurchaseAgreementRateCounterpartyRe.description: Description of Power Purchase Agreement counterparty reporting requirements.

PowerPurchaseAgreementRateCounterpartyTa.description: Amount of counterparty tax obligations in the Power Purchase Agreement.
Description of counterparty tax obligations in the Power Purchase Agreement.

PowerPurchaseAgreementRateEmailAddressTo.description: Email address for billing contact for Power Purchase Agreement off taker.

PowerPurchaseAgreementRateEscalator.description: Percent escalator of the Power Purchase Agreement.

PowerPurchaseAgreementRateExpectedAmount.description: Power Purchase Agreement expected revenue generated.
Power Purchase Agreement expected revenue generated from inception to date.

PowerPurchaseAgreementRateHostTelephoneT.description: Telephone number of individual who receives Power Purchase Agreement notices.

PowerPurchaseAgreementRateInvoicingDate.description: Date of the Power Purchase Agreement invoice.

PowerPurchaseAgreementRateLongTermContra.description: Expiration date of the Power Purchase Agreement.

PowerPurchaseAgreementRateNameOfContactT.description: Billing contact for Power Purchase Agreement off taker.

PowerPurchaseAgreementRateNameOfHostToRe.description: Name of the host company which should receive Power Purchase Agreement notices regarding activities related to the PPA. The host company is the entity with control of the site for the distributed generation system.

PowerPurchaseAgreementRatePaymentDeadlin.description: Deadline date for Power Purchase Agreement payment.

PowerPurchaseAgreementRatePaymentMethod.description: Description of payment terms for Power Purchase Agreement payments.

PowerPurchaseAgreementRatePhoneOfInvoice.description: Telephone number for billing contact at Power Purchase Agreement off taker.

EnergyContractRatePricePerEnergyUnit.description: Purchase price per unit of energy (i.e. 1 kWh) generated by the system.

PowerPurchaseAgreementRateProductionCap.description: Amount of the production cap in the Power Purchase Agreement in kWh.

PowerPurchaseAgreementRateProductionGuar.description: Amount of energy (kWh) guaranteed to be generated by the installation in the Power Purchase Agreement.
The period during which the guaranteed production of the system in kWhs is calculated. For example, the amount is guaranteed over a period of a month or year.

PowerPurchaseAgreementRateRemainingTermo.description: Estimated time left remaining in the Power Purchase Agreement (PPA) or lease based on how much output has been generated so far compared to the original guaranteed output in the PPA or lease. Calculated as Last Payment Date minus Cut-off Date. The value should be entered using the ISO8601 format of PnYnMnDTnHnMnS. For example, a 5-year term would be represented as P5Y, a 3-month term as P3M, and a 4-year, 6-month and 10-day term would be represented as P4Y6M10D.

PowerPurchaseAgreementRateSeasoningNumbe.description: Total number of payments made to date in the Power Purchase Agreement or lease.

PowerPurchaseAgreementRateSystemTrueUpPr.description: True up equals the difference between the amount of kWh originally estimated and the actual output.

PowerPurchaseAgreementRateTimeOfUseFlag.description: Used to indicate if an hourly rate schedule is used. If hourly rate schedule is used, TRUE; if hourly rate schedule is not used, FALSE.

PowerPurchaseAgreementRateTotalUpfrontPa.description: Total amount paid toward the system cost by customer at the start of installation.

PowerPurchaseAgreementRateTrueupTiming.description: The frequency at which the true up occurs. For example, the true up occurs once per year, once per month.

PowerPurchaseAgreementRateType.description: Description of rate type for Power Purchase Agreement, e.g. $/kWh.

PolicyFormVersion.description: Form and version number of the insurance policy.

PowerTargetCapMeasurement.description: Power expected for capacity measurement when executing IEC 61742-2 for the specified target conditions.

PredictedEnergyAvailabilityEstimateRatio.description: Predicted Energy Availability Estimate by Year, which is the modelled predicted energy for unity availability. The ratio is calculated by dividing PredictedEnergyAtTheRevenueMeterInstant by PredictedEnergyAvailable. This element can be used with the PeriodAxis to indicate the period such as year and has a period type of instant to measure a point in time.

PredictedAllInOneYearYield.description: Predicted total (all-in) yield for a one year period.

PredictedEnergyAtTheRevenueMeterForPerio.description: Predicted active electrical production at the revenue meter for each year, based on historical weather data that is representative for the site, per IEC 61724-3. Calculated as Total Predicted Energy reflecting times of unavailability and parasitic loss. This element can be used with the PeriodAxis to indicate the period such as year and has a period type of instant to measure a point in time. If no Period [Axis] is used, the time period for the value is from the date of the value in the instance document to the end of the life of the system.

PredictedEnergyAtTheRevenueMeter.description: Predicted active electrical production at the revenue meter for each year, based on historical weather data that is representative for the site, per IEC 61724-3. Calculated as Total Predicted Energy reflecting times of unavailability and parasitic loss. This element is defined as the sum of electrical production over a period of time, for example from the 1st day to the last day of the month, and has a period type of duration. This should not be used with the Period [Axis].

PredictedEnergyAvailable.description: Predicted energy available is calculated as predicted energy (at unity availability which means that energy is available all the time) multiplied by predicted availability equals predicted energy (at predicted availability). For example, if 10,000 MWh is predicted for unity availability and we predict availability of 0.99, then predicted energy is 9,900 MWh. 10,000=9,900/0.99. This element should be used with the PeriodAxis to indicate the period such as year.

PricingFileAvailabilityOfDocument.description: Indicates if the Pricing File is available. If it is available, TRUE; if it is not available, FALSE.

PricingModelResidualValueAssumption.description: Value of project at end of its economic useful life per the pricing model.
