TermSheetExpirationDate.description: Expiration date of the Term Sheet.

CustomTestConditionAirMass.description: Air mass during the test condition.

CustomTestConditionAmbientTemperature.description: Ambient temperature during the test condition. Can be reported as Celsius or Fahrenheit by the preparer when specifying units in the instance document.

CustomTestConditionCellTemperature.description: Ambient temperature during the test condition. Can be reported as Celsius or Fahrenheit by the preparer when specifying units in the instance document.

CustomTestConditionIrradianceAmount.description: Amount of irradiance during the test condition.

CustomTestConditionWindSpeed.description: Wind speed during the test condition.

ThirdPartyEngagementFee.description: Amount of the total fee for the engagement.

ThirdPartyEngagementHiringEntity.description: Description of type of entity who engaged the third party, for example, Sponsor, Fund, Bank.

ThirdPartyEngagementQualityofWork.description: Description of the quality of the work delivered.

ThirdPartyName.description: Full legal name of a third party.

ThirdPartyVendorCode.description: The vendor code in the bank's internal systems.

TitlePolicyAvailable.description: Indication as to whether the site has a title policy available.

TitlePolicyExceptionDescription.description: Description of the title policy exception.

TitlePolicyExclusionDescription.description: Description of the Title Policy Exclusion.

TitlePolicyExclusionIdentifier.description: Identifier for the Title Policy Exclusion.

TitlePolicyInsuranceCompany.description: Name of the insurance company for the title insurance.

TitlePolicyInsuranceFinalPolicyLink.description: Link to the final title policy insurance document.

TitlePolicyInsuranceProformaDocumentLink.description: Link to the pro forma document for the title policy.

TitlePolicyInsuranceStatus.description: Status of the title policy, which may be Not applicable, Not issued, Pro Forma, or Final.

TitleSurveyAvailabilityOfDocument.description: Indicates if the Title Survey is available. If it is available, TRUE; if it is not available, FALSE.

TitleSurveyAvailabilityOfDocumentExcepti.description: Indicates if there are exceptions to the Title Survey or issues raised. If there are exceptions, TRUE; if there are no exceptions, FALSE.

TitleSurveyAvailabilityOfFinalDocument.description: Indicates if the Title Survey is available in final form. If it is available in fnal form, TRUE; if it is only available in draft form, FALSE.

TitleSurveyCounterparties.description: Names of counterparties to the Title Survey.

TitleSurveyDocumentLink.description: Link to the Title Survey document.

TitleSurveyEffectiveDate.description: Effective date of the Title Survey.

TitleSurveyExceptionDescription.description: Description of any exceptions to the Title Survey or issues raised.

TitleSurveyExpirationDate.description: Expiration date of the Title Survey.

TotalExpectedEnergyAtRevenueMeter.description: Sum of expected energies for both times of availability and unavailability, calculated as Expected Energy At Revenue Meter + Expected Energy At Unavailable Times. This element should be used with the Period Axis to indicate the period.

TrackerAltitude.description: The height of the tracker from ground-level.

TrackerMaterialsWorkmanshipWarrantyExpir.description: Tracker Materials & Workmanship Warranty expiration date.

TrackerMaterialsWorkmanshipWarrantyIniti.description: Tracker Materials & Workmanship Warranty initiation date.

TrackerNumberOfControllers.description: Number of tracker controllers which are electronic devices that directs the tracker.

TrackerStowWindSpeed.description: Stow wind speed in meters/second; tracker stow threshold

TrackerStyle.description: Indicates whether the system tracker is fixed, horizontal axis, two-axis, vertical, vertical-axis, or seasonal tilt.

TrackerIsFixedTilt.description: Indicator if the tracker is fixed tilt; if it is TRUE, if it is not, FALSE.

TrackerTilt.description: The tracker's tilt angle in degrees from horizontal, where zero degrees is horizontal, and 90 degrees is vertical and facing the equator (in both the southern and northern hemispheres).

TransformerDesignFactor.description: Multiplier indicating the amount that the module can operate at above the nameplate capacity. For example at factor of 1.1, can safely operate 10% above the stated nameplate capacity rating.

TransformerStyle.description: Description of the tranformer technology style used such as 2/3/4 winding, Inverter step up transformer.

TransformerTemperature.description: Transformer temperature. Can be reported as Celsius or Fahrenheit by the preparer when specifying units in the instance document.

TransmissionReportandCurtailmentEstimate.description: Indicates if the Transmission Report and Curtailment Estimate is available. If it is available, TRUE; if it is not available, FALSE.
Indicates if there are exceptions to the Transmission Report and Curtailment Estimate or issues raised. If there are exceptions, TRUE; if there are no exceptions, FALSE.
Indicates if there are exceptions to the Transmission Report and Curtailment Estimate or issues raised. If there are exceptions, TRUE; if there are no exceptions, FALSE.
Description of exceptions to the transmission and curtailment report.
Indicates if the Transmission Report and Curtailment Estimate is available in final form. If it is available in fnal form, TRUE; if it is only available in draft form, FALSE.
Names of counterparties to the Transmission Report and Curtailment Estimate.
Effective date of the Transmission Report and Curtailment Estimate.
Expiration date of the Transmission Report and Curtailment Estimate.

TransmissionReportAndCurtailmentEstimate.description: Link to the Transmission Report And Curtailment Estimate document.

TypeOfDevice.description: The value of the item defined as a member for equipment for example, ModuleMember, TransformerMember, LoggerMember.

UCCPrecautionaryLeaseFilingAvailabilityO.description: Indicates if the UCC Precautionary Lease Filing is available. If it is available, TRUE; if it is not available, FALSE.
Indicates if there are exceptions to the UCC Precautionary Lease Filing or issues raised. If there are exceptions, TRUE; if there are no exceptions, FALSE.

Indicates if the UCC Precautionary Lease Filing, a legal form filed to indicate that they have or will have an interest in the property of the debtor. is available in final form. If it is available in fnal form, TRUE; if it is only available in draft form, FALSE.

UCCPrecautionaryLeaseFilingCounterpartie.description: Names of counterparties to the UCC Precautionary Lease Filing, a legal form filed to indicate that they have or will have an interest in the property of the debtor.

UCCPrecautionaryLeaseFilingDocumentLink.description: Link to the UCC Precautionary Lease Filing document.

UCCPrecautionaryLeaseFilingEffectiveDate.description: Effective date of the UCC Precautionary Lease Filing, a legal form filed to indicate that they have or will have an interest in the property of the debtor.

UCCPrecautionaryLeaseFilingExceptionDesc.description: Description of any exceptions to the UCC Precautionary Lease Filing or issues raised.

UCCPrecautionaryLeaseFilingExpirationDat.description: Expiration date of the UCC Precautionary Lease Filing, a legal form filed to indicate that they have or will have an interest in the property of the debtor.

UCCSecurityAgreementAvailabilityOfDocume.description: Indicates if the UCC Security Agreement is available. If it is available, TRUE; if it is not available, FALSE.
Indicates if there are exceptions to the UCC Security Agreement or issues raised. If there are exceptions, TRUE; if there are no exceptions, FALSE.

UCCSecurityAgreementExceptionDescription.description: Description of any exceptions to the UCC Security Agreement or issues raised.

UCCSecurityAgreementExpirationDate.description: Expiration date of the UCC Security Agreement.

Indicates if there are exceptions to the UCC Tax Lien and Judgment Lien Searches or issues raised. If there are exceptions, TRUE; if there are no exceptions, FALSE.
Indicates if the UCC Tax Lien and Judgment Lien Searches are available in final form. If it is available in fnal form, TRUE; if it is only available in draft form, FALSE.

UCCTaxLienAndJudgmentLienSearchesCounter.description: Names of counterparties to the UCC Tax Lien and Judgment Lien Searches.

UCCTaxLienAndJudgmentLienSearchesEffecti.description: Effective date of the UCC Tax Lien and Judgment Lien Searches.

UCCTaxLienAndJudgmentLienSearchesExcepti.description: Description of any exceptions to the UCC Tax Lien and Judgment Lien Searches or issues raised.

UCCTaxLienAndJudgmentLienSearchesExpirat.description: Expiration date of the UCC Tax Lien and Judgment Lien Searches.

UCCTaxLienAndJudgmentSearchesDocumentLin.description: Link to the UCC Tax Lien And Judgment Searches document.

UnderwritingAvailabilityOfPrepaidExpense.description: Prepaid expenses are available for the project; if available, TRUE; if not available, FALSE.

UnderwritingCrossCollateralizationStruct.description: Description of cross collateralization structure among funds.

UnderwritingLetterOfCreditPurpose.description: Description of purpose of Letter of Credit

UnderwritingOtherUniqueUnderwritingStruc.description: Description of any other features of the underwriting structure.

UnderwritingRentCoverageRatio.description: Rent coverage ratio, defined as Earnings Before Income, Tax, Depreciation and Amortization, divided by rent payments.

UnderwritingTerminationValueGap.description: Difference between the actual termination value and the present value of the project value at the time of the termination.

UpdatedMajorDesignModel.description: Type of design model when the model is changed which could be Pvsyst, SAM, PV Watts, or Other.

UseOfFundsAmount.description: Amount of the payment made for the use of the funds.

UseOfFundsCounterpartyIdentifier.description: Identifier for the counterparty that is using the funds.

UseOfFundsDescription.description: Description of the contribution, for example, 45% of funding provided for XYZ project.

UseOfFundsEntityType.description: Indication of the type of entity using the funds which could be Special Purpose Vehicle (SPV), Counterparty or Third Party.

UseOfFundsProjectSpecificFlag.description: Indication as to whether the use of funds is for a specific project. If it is for a specific project, TRUE; if it is not for a specific project, FALSE.

UseOfFundsSPVIdentifier.description: Identifier for the SPV that is using the funds.

UseOfFundsThirdPartyIdentifier.description: Identifier for the third party that is using the funds.

UtilitiesCosts.description: Utilities costs incurred during the reporting period for services, such as water, sewer, gas, electricity and telephone required to operate a building.

UtilityContactName.description: Contact name for the utility company where the grid connection will reside.

UtilityContactTitle.description: Contact title for the utility company where the grid connection will reside.

UtilityCostBasedIncentiveAmount.description: Tax Rebate Incentive based on the cost of the system

UtilityElectricityCost.description: Electricity cost for the utility company where the grid connection will reside in amount per kWh.

UtilityElectricityExpense.description: Amount for the electricity expense for the utility company where the grid connection will reside.

UtilityGrantAmount.description: Reduction in system cost by grant amount

UtilityName.description: Name of utility company where the grid connection will reside.

UtilityProductionBasedIncentiveRate.description: Incentive based on the production of the system, provided by the Utility.

UtilityRateName.description: Name of the rate charged by the utility to the offtaker.

UtilityRateNameApplicableDates.description: Date range for the time period during which the Utility rate is applicable.

UtilityRenumerationTypeDescription.description: Method of compensation for energy produced by solar installation, for example, net energy metering, feed-in tarriff.

UtilityLegalEntityIdentifier.description: The Legal Entity Identifier of the utility.

VegetationManagementAreaOfVegetation.description: Amount of acreage where there is vegetation such as trees and grass that must be managed by the project.

VegetationManagementCostPerAcre.description: Proforma and actual cost of vegetation management in currency per acre.

VegetationManagementEquipmentRentalExpen.description: Rental expense for equipment used for vegetation management.

VegetationManagementFrequencyOfManagemen.description: Number of times per year vegetation is tended.

WashingAndWasteCostPerModule.description: Cost to wash an individual module.

WashingAndWasteExpenseOfWater.description: Cost of water used to wash.

WashingAndWasteFrequencyOfWashing.description: Number of times per year equipment must be washed.

WashingAndWasteModuleQuantityCount.description: Number of solar modules that are washed.

WashingAndWasteQuantityOfWater.description: Amount of water needed for washing in gallons.

WiringInstructionsAvailabilityOfDocument.description: Indicates if the Wiring Instructions is available. If it is available, TRUE; if it is not available, FALSE.
Indicates if there are exceptions to the Wiring Instructions or issues raised. If there are exceptions, TRUE; if there are no exceptions, FALSE.

WiringInstructionsAvailabilityOfFinalDoc.description: Indicates if the Wiring Instructions is available in final form. If it is available in fnal form, TRUE; if it is only available in draft form, FALSE.

WiringInstructionsCounterparties.description: Names of counterparties to the Wiring Instructions.

WiringInstructionsDocumentLink.description: Link to the Wiring Instructions document.

WiringInstructionsEffectiveDate.description: Effective date of the Wiring Instructions.

WiringInstructionsExceptionDescription.description: Description of any exceptions to the Wiring Instructions or issues raised.

WiringInstructionsExpirationDate.description: Expiration date of the Wiring Instructions.

ZoningCovenant.description: Description of the zoning covenant / obligation.

ZoningPermitIdentifier.description: Identifier for the zoning permit related to a site.

ZoningPermitCreditRequired.description: Does the sponsor need to post credit support for site restoration and system removal conditions. If the sponsor needs to post credit support, TRUE; if not, FALSE.

ZoningPermitDocumentsLink.description: Link to the actual zoning permit document.

ZoningPermitDocumentsType.description: Description of the type of documents which could be a permit or a supporting document.

ZoningPermitIssueDate.description: Date on which the permit was issued.

ZoningPermitProperty.description: Identifies whether this is a permit for the plant, gen tie line, or substation.

ZoningPermitRecurringFee.description: Description of the amount, frequency and timing of the recurring fee.

ZoningPermitRecurringFeeRequired.description: Indicates if there is a recurring fee for the zoning permit. If there is a recurring fee, TRUE; if there is not, FALSE.

ZoningPermitRenewable.description: Indicates if the zoning permit can be renewed at the end of the term. If it can be renewed, TRUE; if it cannot be renewed, FALSE.

ZoningPermitRequired.description: Indication as to whether a zoning permit is required.

ZoningPermitSiteRestorationRequired.description: Indicates if the site needs to be restored at the end of the term. If the site needs to be restored, TRUE; if not required, FALSE.

ZoningPermitSystemRemovalRequired.description: Indicates if the zoning permit requires system removal at the end of the term. If system removal is required, TRUE; if not required, FALSE.

ZoningPermitTerm.description: Term of the permit. The value should be entered using the ISO8601 format of PnYnMnDTnHnMnS. For example, a 5-year term would be represented as P5Y, a 3-month term as P3M, and a 4-year, 6-month and 10-day term would be represented as P4Y6M10D.

ZoningPermitTerminationProvision.description: Description of the zoning permit termination provision.

ZoningPermitTerminationRightsName.description: Name of the individual or organization that has termination rights.

ZoningPermitType.description: Description of the type of zoning permit, for example, Special Use, Conditional Use, Variance.

ZoningPermitUpfrontFeeAmount.description: Amount of the upfront fee for the zoning permit.

ZoningPermitUpfrontFeeRequired.description: Indicates if there is an upfront fee. If there is an upfront fee, TRUE; if there is not an upfront fee, FALSE.

ZoningPermitUpfrontFeeStatus.description: Description of the status of the upfront fee, for example, Not Applicable, Not Due, Overdue, Partially Paid, Fully Paid.

ZoningPermitUpfrontFeeTiming.description: Timing of the upfront fee for the zoning permit.

ShortTermInvestments.description: Amount of investments including trading securities, available-for-sale securities, held-to-maturity securities, and short-term investments classified as other and current.

ReceivablesNetCurrent.description: The total amount due to the entity within one year of the balance sheet date (or one operating cycle, if longer) from outside sources, including trade accounts receivable, notes and loans receivable, as well as any other types of receivables, net of allowances established for the purpose of reducing such receivables to an amount that approximates their net realizable value.

PrepaidExpenseCurrent.description: Amount of asset related to consideration paid in advance for costs that provide economic benefits within a future period of one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

DeferredCostsCurrent.description: Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date of deferred costs capitalized at the end of the reporting period that are expected to be charged against earnings within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

IncomeTaxesReceivable.description: Carrying amount due within one year of the balance sheet date (or one operating cycle, if longer) from tax authorities as of the balance sheet date representing refunds of overpayments or recoveries based on agreed-upon resolutions of disputes.

DeferredTaxAssetsLiabilitiesNetCurrent.description: Amount, after allocation of valuation allowances and deferred tax liability, of deferred tax asset attributable to deductible differences and carryforwards, netted by jurisdiction and classified as current.

OtherAssetsCurrent.description: Amount of current assets classified as other.

AssetsCurrent.description: Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date of all assets that are expected to be realized in cash, sold, or consumed within one year (or the normal operating cycle, if longer). Assets are probable future economic benefits obtained or controlled by an entity as a result of past transactions or events.

PropertyPlantAndEquipmentGross.description: Amount before accumulated depreciation, depletion and amortization of physical assets used in the normal conduct of business and not intended for resale. Examples include, but are not limited to, land, buildings, machinery and equipment, office equipment, and furniture and fixtures.

AccumulatedDepreciationDepletionAndAmort.description: Amount of accumulated depreciation, depletion and amortization for physical assets used in the normal conduct of business to produce goods and services.

PropertyPlantAndEquipmentNet.description: Amount after accumulated depreciation, depletion and amortization of physical assets used in the normal conduct of business to produce goods and services and not intended for resale. Examples include, but are not limited to, land, buildings, machinery and equipment, office equipment, and furniture and fixtures.

DeferredCosts.description: Sum of the carrying amounts of deferred costs that are expected to be recognized as a charge against earnings in periods after one year or beyond the normal operating cycle, if longer.

AssetsNoncurrent.description: Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date of all assets that are expected to be realized in cash, sold or consumed after one year or beyond the normal operating cycle, if longer.

AccountsPayableCurrent.description: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of liabilities incurred (and for which invoices have typically been received) and payable to vendors for goods and services received that are used in an entity's business. Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).

AccruedLiabilitiesCurrent.description: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred and payable, pertaining to costs that are statutory in nature, are incurred on contractual obligations, or accumulate over time and for which invoices have not yet been received or will not be rendered. Examples include taxes, interest, rent and utilities. Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).

TaxesPayableCurrent.description: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred and payable for statutory income, sales, use, payroll, excise, real, property and other taxes. Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).

DeferredTaxLiabilitiesCurrent.description: Amount, after deferred tax asset, of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable differences, with jurisdictional netting and classified as current.

DebtCurrent.description: Amount of short-term debt and current maturity of long-term debt and capital lease obligations due within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

AccruedEnvironmentalLossContingenciesCur.description: Carrying value of the obligation (known or estimated) arising from requirements to perform activities to remediate one or more sites, payable in twelve months or in the next operating cycle if longer.

AssetRetirementObligationCurrent.description: Current portion of the carrying amount of a liability for an asset retirement obligation. An asset retirement obligation is a legal obligation associated with the disposal or retirement of a tangible long-lived asset that results from the acquisition, construction or development, or the normal operations of a long-lived asset, except for certain obligations of lessees.

OtherLiabilitiesCurrent.description: Amount of liabilities classified as other, due within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

LiabilitiesCurrent.description: Total obligations incurred as part of normal operations that are expected to be paid during the following twelve months or within one business cycle, if longer.

LongTermDebtNoncurrent.description: Amount after unamortized (discount) premium and debt issuance costs of long-term debt classified as noncurrent and excluding amounts to be repaid within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer. Includes, but not limited to, notes payable, bonds payable, debentures, mortgage loans and commercial paper. Excludes capital lease obligations.

CapitalLeaseObligationsNoncurrent.description: Amount equal to the present value (the principal) at the beginning of the lease term of minimum lease payments during the lease term (excluding that portion of the payments representing executory costs such as insurance, maintenance, and taxes to be paid by the lessor, together with any profit thereon) net of payments or other amounts applied to the principal, through the balance sheet date and due to be paid more than one year (or one operating cycle, if longer) after the balance sheet date.

LongTermDebtAndCapitalLeaseObligations.description: Amount of long-term debt and capital lease obligation due after one year or beyond the normal operating cycle, if longer.

AccountsPayableAndAccruedLiabilitiesNonc.description: Sum of the carrying values as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred through that date and due after one year (or beyond the operating cycle if longer), including liabilities for compensation costs, fringe benefits other than pension and postretirement obligations, rent, contractual rights and obligations, and statutory obligations.

DeferredRevenueAndCreditsNoncurrent.description: Total carrying amount of consideration received or receivable as of the balance sheet date representing potential earnings that were not as yet recognized as revenue or other forms of income in conformity with GAAP, and which are expected to be recognized as such after one year or beyond the normal operating cycle, if longer.

AssetRetirementObligationsNoncurrent.description: Noncurrent portion of the carrying amount of a liability for an asset retirement obligation. An asset retirement obligation is a legal obligation associated with the disposal or retirement of a tangible long-lived asset that results from the acquisition, construction or development, or the normal operations of a long-lived asset, except for certain obligations of lessees.

DeferredTaxLiabilitiesNoncurrent.description: Amount, after deferred tax asset, of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable differences, with jurisdictional netting and classified as noncurrent.

OtherLiabilitiesNoncurrent.description: Amount of liabilities classified as other, due after one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

LiabilitiesOtherThanLongtermDebtNoncurre.description: Aggregated carrying amounts of obligations as of the balance sheet date, excluding long-term debt, incurred as part of the normal operations that are expected to be paid after one year or beyond the normal operating cycle, if longer. Alternate captions include Total Deferred Credits and Other Liabilities.

LiabilitiesNoncurrent.description: Amount of obligation due after one year or beyond the normal operating cycle, if longer.

PreferredStockValue.description: Aggregate par or stated value of issued nonredeemable preferred stock (or preferred stock redeemable solely at the option of the issuer). This item includes treasury stock repurchased by the entity. Note: elements for number of nonredeemable preferred shares, par value and other disclosure concepts are in another section within stockholders' equity.

CommonStockValue.description: Aggregate par or stated value of issued nonredeemable common stock (or common stock redeemable solely at the option of the issuer). This item includes treasury stock repurchased by the entity. Note: elements for number of nonredeemable common shares, par value and other disclosure concepts are in another section within stockholders' equity.

AdditionalPaidInCapital.description: Excess of issue price over par or stated value of the entity's capital stock and amounts received from other transactions involving the entity's stock or stockholders. Includes adjustments to additional paid in capital. Some examples of such adjustments include recording the issuance of debt with a beneficial conversion feature and certain tax consequences of equity instruments awarded to employees. Use this element for the aggregate amount of additional paid-in capital associated with common and preferred stock. For additional paid-in capital associated with only common stock, use the element additional paid in capital, common stock. For additional paid-in capital associated with only preferred stock, use the element additional paid in capital, preferred stock.

TreasuryStockValue.description: The amount allocated to treasury stock. Treasury stock is common and preferred shares of an entity that were issued, repurchased by the entity, and are held in its treasury.

AccumulatedOtherComprehensiveIncomeLossN.description: Accumulated change in equity from transactions and other events and circumstances from non-owner sources, net of tax effect, at period end. Excludes Net Income (Loss), and accumulated changes in equity from transactions resulting from investments by owners and distributions to owners. Includes foreign currency translation items, certain pension adjustments, unrealized gains and losses on certain investments in debt and equity securities, other than temporary impairment (OTTI) losses related to factors other than credit losses on available-for-sale and held-to-maturity debt securities that an entity does not intend to sell and it is not more likely than not that the entity will be required to sell before recovery of the amortized cost basis, as well as changes in the fair value of derivatives related to the effective portion of a designated cash flow hedge.

RetainedEarningsAccumulatedDeficit.description: The cumulative amount of the reporting entity's undistributed earnings or deficit.

StockholdersEquity.description: Total of all stockholders' equity (deficit) items, net of receivables from officers, directors, owners, and affiliates of the entity which are attributable to the parent. The amount of the economic entity's stockholders' equity attributable to the parent excludes the amount of stockholders' equity which is allocable to that ownership interest in subsidiary equity which is not attributable to the parent (noncontrolling interest, minority interest). This excludes temporary equity and is sometimes called permanent equity.

DeveloperFederalTaxIdentificationNumber.description: Federal tax identification number for the developer.

AssetManagerFederalTaxIdentificationNumb.description: Federal tax identification number for the Asset Manager.

OperationsManagerFederalTaxIdentificatio.description: Federal tax identification number for the Operations Manager.

GridCodeCompliance.description: Indicates if the IEC 62445-1 or local Grid Code Compliance has been met. If it has been met, TRUE; if it has not been met, FALSE

SoilInSiteReportAvailable.description: Indicates if the report providing details of soil consistency, chemistry, site soil measurements (probing trench, probing drill, etc) has been submitted. If it has been submitted, TRUE; if it has not been submitted, FALSE

IECRERulesOfProcedureMet.description: Indicates if IEC RE Rules Of Procedure have been met. If it has been met, TRUE; if it has not been met, FALSE

PPAContractReviewConsidered.description: Indicates if a review of the PPA contract has been considered. If it has been considered, TRUE; if it has not been considered, FALSE.

SitePermitReviewConsidered.description: Indicates if the site permit review has been considered. If it has been considered, TRUE; if it has not been considered, FALSE.

OffTakerContractReviewConsidered.description: Indicates if the offtaker contract review has been considered. If it has been considered, TRUE; if it has not been considered, FALSE.

OperationsAndMaintenanceContractReviewCo.description: Indicates if the O&M contract review has been considered. If it has been considered, TRUE; if it has not been considered, FALSE.

EPCContractReviewConsidered.description: Indicates if the EPC contract review has been considered. If it has been considered, TRUE; if it has not been considered, FALSE.

SuppliersContractReviewConsidered.description: Indicates if the suppliers contract review has been considered. If it has been considered, TRUE; if it has not been considered, FALSE.

GeotechnicalReportReviewed.description: Indicates if the geotechnical report has been reviewed. If it has been reviewed, TRUE; if it has not been reviewed, FALSE.

FireRiskReportSubmitted.description: Indicates if the fire risk report has been submitted. If it has been submitted, TRUE; if it has not been submitted, FALSE.

EcologicalReportReviewed.description: Indicates if the econological/wildlife/plant life report has been reviewed. If it has been reviewed, TRUE; if it has not been reviewed, FALSE.

CulturalReportReviewed.description: Indicates if the cultural resources and archeological report has been reviewed. If it has been reviewed, TRUE; if it has not been reviewed, FALSE.

OperationalIssuesResolutionTime.description: Resolution Time (repair time) is the time to resolve the fault starting from the moment of reaching the PV plant. Resolution Time is may not be guaranteed, because resolution time often does not depend totally on the O&M Contractor. The value should be entered as a durationItemType using the ISO8601 format of PnYnMnDTnHnMnS, where H means hours, M means minutes, and S means seconds.

OperationalIssuesAcknowledgementTime.description: The time between detecting the problem (receipt of the alarm or noticing a fault) and the acknowledgement of the fault by the O&M Contractor which is signaled by dispatching a technician. The acknowledgement time reflects the O&M Contractors operational ability. The value should be entered as a durationItemType using the ISO8601 format of PnYnMnDTnHnMnS. Acknowledgement Time may also be called Reaction Time, where H means hours, M means minutes, and S means seconds.

OperationalIssuesInterventionTime.description: The amount of time to reach the plant by a service technician or a subcontractor when the visit by the O&M contractor is contractually necessary, from the moment of acknowledgement. Intervention Time assesses the capacity of the O&M Contractor to mobilize and be on site. The value should be entered as a durationItemType using the ISO8601 format of PnYnMnDTnHnMnS, where H means hours, M means minutes, and S means seconds.

OperationalIssuesWarrantyRelated.description: Indicates that the operational issue is warranty related. If it is warranty related, TRUE; if it is not, FALSE

OperationalIssuesEnvironmentalHealthAndS.description: Indicates that the operational issue is warranty related. If it is environmental health and safety related, TRUE; if it is not, FALSE

AverageTimeBetweenEquipmentFailures.description: Average amount of time between failures of any piece of equipment or the system as a whole. The value should be entered as a durationItemType using the ISO8601 format of PnYnMnDTnHnMnS, where H means hours, M means minutes, and S means seconds.

SystemSparePartsStatusLevel.description: Indicates if the status of the spare parts level is sufficient or insufficient.

SystemPreventiveMaintenanceTasksStatus.description: Indication of the status of preventative maintenance tasks performed for cycle, which can be complete or incomplete.

EstimationPeriodForCurtailment.description: Period in which the curtailment amount or percent is estimated, in 'PnYnMnDTnHnMnS' format, for example, 'P1Y5M13D' represents reported fact of one year, five months, and thirteen days, or 'P1Y' represents a reported fact for one year, or 'P1M' represents a reported fact for one month. Should be used with the EstimationPeriodStartDateAxis which represents the starting date for the period.

CurtailmentEconomicModelFactorPercent.description: Percentage of energy lost due to economic curtailment based on major design/energy production model. Economic curtailment is a result of wholesale market pricing, etc. To report estimated values for specified future periods, use the EstimationPeriodStartDateAxis, in conjunction with the concept EstimationPeriodForCurtailment.

CurtailmentStabilityOrCongestionModelFac.description: Percentage of energy lost due to stability or congestion curtailment on the transmission system, based on major design/energy production model. To report estimated values for specified future periods, use the EstimationPeriodStartDateAxis, in conjunction with the concept EstimationPeriodForCurtailment.

CurtailmentEmergencyOrConstructionModelF.description: Percentage of energy lost due to curtailment from emergencies or construction work, based on major design/energy production model.To report estimated values for specified future periods, use the EstimationPeriodStartDateAxis, in conjunction with the concept EstimationPeriodForCurtailment.

CurtailmentOtherModelFactorPercent.description: Percentage of energy lost due to curtailment caused by reasons other than economics (wholesale market pricing or the like), stability, congestion, emergencies, or construction. Value reported should be based on major design/energy production model. To report estimated values for specified future periods, use the EstimationPeriodStartDateAxis, in conjunction with the concept EstimationPeriodForCurtailment.

CurtailmentTotalModelFactorPercent.description: Percentage of energy lost due to curtailment based on major design/energy production model. To report estimated values for specified future periods, use the EstimationPeriodStartDateAxis, and the EstimationPeriodForCurtailment.

CurtailmentEconomicModelFactorAmount.description: Amount of energy lost due to economic curtailment based on major design/energy production model. Economic curtailment is a result of wholesale market pricing, etc. To report estimated values for specified future periods, use the EstimationPeriodStartDateAxis, in conjunction with the concept EstimationPeriodForCurtailment.

CurtailmentStabilityOrCongestionModelFac.description: Amount of energy lost due to stability or congestion curtailment on the transmission system, based on major design/energy production model. To report estimated values for specified future periods, use the EstimationPeriodStartDateAxis, in conjunction with the concept EstimationPeriodForCurtailment.

CurtailmentEmergencyOrConstructionModelF.description: Amount of energy lost due to curtailment based on major design/energy production model for emergencies or construction work.To report estimated values for specified future periods, use the EstimationPeriodStartDateAxis, in conjunction with the concept EstimationPeriodForCurtailment.

CurtailmentOtherModelFactorAmount.description: Amount of energy lost due to curtailment based on major design/energy production model due to reasons other than economics (wholesale market pricing or the like), stability, congestion, emergencies, or construction. To report estimated values for specified future periods, use the EstimationPeriodStartDateAxis, in conjunction with the concept EstimationPeriodForCurtailment.

CurtailmentTotalModelFactorAmount.description: Amount of energy lost due to curtailment based on major design/energy production model.To report estimated values for specified future periods, use the EstimationPeriodStartDateAxis, in conjunction with the concept EstimationPeriodForCurtailment.

EstimatedSystemDegradationRate.description: Estimated degradation rate of the system, in percent of kWh lost. To report estimated values for specified future periods, use the EstimationPeriodStartDateAxis, in conjunction with the concept EstimationPeriodForCurtailment.

EstimatedArrayDegradationRate.description: Estimated percent capacity of the array lost in future periods, e.g., year, month, due to degradation. Should be used with the EstimationPeriodStartDateAxis, in conjunction with the concept EstimationPeriodForCurtailment.

EstimationPeriodForDegradationMeasure.description: Period in which the degradation amount or percent is estimated, in 'PnYnMnDTnHnMnS' format, for example, 'P1Y5M13D' represents reported fact of one year, five months, and thirteen days, or 'P1Y' represents a reported fact for one year, or 'P1M' represents a reported fact for one month. Should be used with the EstimationPeriodStartDateAxis which represents the starting date for the period.

MeasuredEnergyLossDueToSoiling.description: Actual (measured) amount of energy lost due to soiling.

MeasuredEnergyLossDueToInverterIssues.description: Actual (measured) amount of energy lost due to inverter issues.

InterAnnualAvailabilityOfEnergy.description: Percentage of P50 energy variation expected year to year over a single standard variation based on the historical variability of weather observed.

InterMonthlyAvailabilityOfEnergy.description: Percentage of P50 energy variation expected between a given month to the same month in the following over a single standard variation year based on the historical variability of weather observed.

SystemMinimumIrradianceThreshold.description: Minimum irradiance required to activate a PV system or subarray.

SystemAvailabilityMeasuredEnergyToMeasur.description: Plant energy production or plant energy metered in the time period divided by the sum of that value and the calculated lost energy in the period (kWh). Energy-Based Availability takes into consideration that an hour in a period with high irradiance is more valuable than in a period with low irradiance.

EnergyReferenceYield.description: The measure of the total energy generated per kWp installed over a certain period of time.

ActiveEnergyOrParasiticLoad.description: Actual amount of active energy consumed by the system, also called Parasitic Load.

SystemUptimeRatio.description: Measure of system availability (uptime), calculated by taking the ratio of total useful time (time during which the plant is operating without taking any exclusion factors into account) minus total downtime, divided by the total useful time, multipled by 100. Total useful time is defined as the time when the plant is exposed to irradiation levels above the generators Minimum Irradiance Threshold (MIT). This measure is sourced from Solar Power Europe.

ProjectEarlyBuyOutAmount.description: Amount of the buy-out at the end of the lease.

ProjectEarlyBuyoutDate.description: In the event of an early buyout, earliest date at which the buyout can occur; can have multiple projects so this would be associated with a project

MeasuredEnergyAvailabilityTurbineIssues.description: Measured energy availability for the indicated time period due to issues with wind turbines on an entire wind farm calculated as the ratio of the total energy that could have been produced minus the energy lost due to turbine issues divided by the total energy that could have been produced.

MeasuredEnergyAvailabilityBalanceOfSyste.description: Measured energy availability for the indicated time period due to issues with Balance of Plant (BOP) components calculated as the ratio of the total energy that could have been produced minus the energy lost due to BOP issues divided by the total energy that could have been produced.

MeasuredEnergyAvailabilitySingleTurbine.description: Measured energy availability for the indicated time period due to issues with the single wind turbine indicated calculated as the ratio of the total energy that could have been produced minus the energy lost due to turbine issues divided by the total energy that could have been produced.

NonoperatingIncomeExpense.description: The aggregate amount of income or expense from ancillary business-related activities (that is to say, excluding major activities considered part of the normal operations of the business).

DeviceIdentifier.description: Identifier for an individual piece of equipment used in a system, for example, ABC Brand inverter with serial number xxxx.

SystemEntityFlag.description: Used to relate a given entity identifier with a given system identifier.

ProductDescription.description: Description of the product, for example, 250 W Utility Interactive Microinverter.

InverterUL1741SupplementACertificationDa.description: Date when the inverter UL1741 Supplement A Certification was received.

InverterHasCertificationUL1741Supplement.description: Inverter has certification UL1741 Supplement A, for Inverters, Converters, Controllers and Interconnection System Equipment for Use with Distributed Energy Resources.

InverterFirmwareVersionTested.description: Version of firmware for the inverter that has been tested, for example, A.4.0.B, B.4.2.2, C.2.0.0.

InverterIsMicroInverter.description: Indicates if the inverter is a microinverter. If it is a microinverter, TRUE; if it is not, FALSE.

InverterCutSheetNotes.description: Descriptive notes about the inverter to be used on a cut sheet.

InverterNightTareLoss.description: Amount of tare power lost at night. Tare losses are a measure of the energy the inverter consumes to power its internal electronics and magnetics.

InverterContinuousPowerRatingAt40Celsius.description: Inverter continuous power rating at 40 degrees celsius.

InverterNightTareLossAt40Celsius.description: Amount of tare power lost at night at 40 degrees celsius. Tare losses are a measure of the energy the inverter consumes to power its internal electronics and magnetics.

InverterWeightedEfficiencyAtVmin.description: Weighted efficiency rating of the inverter at vmin which is the lowest possible operating voltage needed for energy efficiency and reliability optimization.

InverterWeightedEfficiencyAtVmax.description: Weighted efficiency rating of the inverter at vmax which is the lowest possible operating voltage needed for energy efficiency and reliability optimization.

InverterWeightedEfficiencyAtVnom.description: Weighted efficiency rating of the inverter at vmin which is the lowest possible operating voltage needed for energy efficiency and reliability optimization.

InverterEfficiencyAtVminPercent.description: Percent efficiency rating of the inverter at vmin with a specified inverter power level. Vmin is the lowest possible operating voltage needed for energy efficiency and reliability optimization.

InverterEfficiencyAtVmaxPercent.description: Percent efficiency rating of the inverter at vmax with a specified inverter power level. Vmax is the maximum DC input voltage of the inverter in DC.

InverterEfficiencyAtVnomPercent.description: Percent efficiency rating of the inverter at vnom with a specified inverter power level. Vnom is nominal input voltage of the inverter in DC.

ProductModelCutSheetNew.description: Indicates if the cut sheet is revised. If it is new, TRUE; if is not new, FALSE.

ProductModelCutSheetRevisedReason.description: Indicates if the cut sheet is revised. If it is revised, TRUE; if is not revised, FALSE.

ProductModelCutSheetRevised.description: Description of the reason revisions were made to the cut sheet.

EquipmentManufacturerContactName.description: Contact name for the equipment manufacturer.

EquipmentManufacturerAddress1.description: First line of the address of the equipment manufacturer.

EquipmentManufacturerAddress2.description: Second line of the address of the equipment manufacturer.

EquipmentManufacturerAddressCity.description: City where equipment manufacturer is located.

EquipmentManufacturerAddressCountry.description: ISO country code where the equipment manufacturer is located.

EquipmentManufacturerAddressState.description: State or province where the equipment manufacturer is based.

EquipmentManufacturerAddressZipCode.description: Zip (postal) Code where the equipment manufacturer is based.

InverterIsUtilityInteractiveFlag.description: Indicates if the inverter is Utility Interactive. If it is, TRUE; if it is not, FALSE.

InverterIsGridSupportUtilityInteractive.description: Indicates if the inverter is Grid Support Utility Interactive. If it is, TRUE; if it is not, FALSE.

InverterisPartofACPVModule.description: Indicates if the inverter is part of an ACPV Module. If it is, TRUE; if it is not, FALSE.

TestLabIsNRTL.description: Indicates if the test lab used was a Nationally Recognized Testing Laboratory (NRTL) whose Scope of Recognition under the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) includes UL 1741. If it was, TRUE; if it was not, FALSE.

CaliforniaRule21SourceRequirementDocumen.description: Indicates if California Rule 21 was the source requirement document (SRD) for the tests. If it was, TRUE; if it was not, FALSE.

OtherTestingSourceRequirementDocumentsUs.description: Description of source document requirements used for other testing.

TestWasCalibrated.description: Indicates if the test equipment was calibrated when the test was performed. If it was, TRUE; if it was not, FALSE.

AuthorizationToMarkLetterFromNRTL.description: Indicates if the signed Authorization to Mark Letter is from NRTL. If it was, TRUE; if it was not, FALSE.

MaximumContinuousOutputPowerDataFor180Mi.description: Indication if the MCOP (Maximum Continuous Output Power) measured data provided for at least 180 minutes at minimum intervals of 5 minutes. If it was, TRUE; if it was not, FALSE.

PowerRatingInWeightedEfficiencyForm.description: Indication if the Power Rating (continuous at unity power factor) was provided in the weighted efficiency form. If it was, TRUE; if it was not, FALSE.

NightTareLossDatainWeightedEfficiencyFor.description: Indication if the night tare loss data was provided in the Weighted Inverter Efficiency Form. If it was, TRUE; if it was not, FALSE.

WeightedEfficienciesAverageToCECEfficien.description: Indication if the three weighted efficiencies on the Summary sheet average to the CEC Efficiency value for the efficiency graph. If they do, TRUE; if they do not, FALSE.

MicrointerverIsAttachedtoModuleBacksheet.description: Indication if the microinverter is attached to the module backsheet with adhesive. If it was, TRUE; if it was not, FALSE.

TestResultsForSecurementHumidity-FreezeA.description: Indication if test results were submitted for securement, humidity-freeze, and temperature cycling. If they were, TRUE; if they were not, FALSE.

ConstructionDataReportSubmitted.description: Indication if a Construction Data Report (CDR) was submitted. If it was, TRUE; if it was not, FALSE.

MultipleListeeLetterSignedByNRTL.description: Indication if the multiple listee letter for the inverter was signed by an NRTL. If it was, TRUE; if it was not, FALSE.

ModuleTechnology.description: Type of technology used in the module which can be Mono-C-Si (single crystal crystalline silicon technology), Multi-C-Si (uses many crystals crystalline technology), or Thin Film (made by placing one or more films of PV material on a substrate).

ProductNotes.description: Comments or notes about the product that may be found on a cut sheet. For example, ABC product also sold under the name XYZ product, or Model has been discontinued, or Part of family of several other models.

ModuleRatedCurrentAtNOCT.description: Value of the current when module is operating at maximum power and at NOCT (nominal operating cell temperature). May also be called Maximum Power Current or IPmax, NOCT.

ModuleRatedVoltageAtNOCT.description: Value of the voltage when module is operating at maximum power and at NOCT (nominal operating cell temperature).  May also be called Maximum Power Voltage or VPmax, NOCT.

ModuleRatedCurrentAtLowIrradiance.description: Value of the current when module is operating at maximum power and at low irradiance. May also be called Maximum Power Current, or IPmax, low.

ModuleRatedVoltageAtLowIrradiance.description: Value of the voltage when module is operating at maximum power and at low irradiance.  May also be called Maximum Power Voltage, or VPmax, low.

ModuleApertureArea.description: Aperture area of the module, measured by the long side of the module multiplied by the short of the module, measured in square meters. Also called A_c.

ModuleSeriesNumberOfCells.description: Number of cells in a solar module series.

MeterMeetsPBIEligibility.description: Indicates if the meter meets Performance Based Incentive Program eligibility with certificate documenting accuracy to less than 2%. If it does, TRUE; if it does not, FALSE.

MeterDisplayType.description: Description of the meter display type, for example, LCD, digital, cyclometer.

CECListingDate.description: Date when the product model was listed in the California Commission (CEC) repository.

ProductCertifyingBody.description: Name of the organization certifying the product.

ProductCertificateHolder.description: Name of the holder of the product certification.

ProductCertificationIssueDate.description: Issue date of the product certification.

ProductCertificateType.description: Description of the product certificate type.

ModuleBypassDiodeOptimalNumber.description: Optimal number of bypass diodes for system integration. Bypass diodes are used to eliminate the hot-spot phenomena which can damage PV cells and even cause fire if the light hitting the surface of the PV cells in a module is not uniform.

ProductCode.description:
A product code is a standardized, unique human-readable identifier that is compact,and can be easily parsed. It consists of an entity code concatenated to a product specific identification string, separated by a hyphen. A product string is up to 16 characters, comprised of upper case letters, number, and hyphens (-).
The format of a product code is:
[EntityCode]-[ProductString], e.g., UEE-E2000-3-XFM for company Universal Energy Enterprises with Entity Code UEE and Product String of E2000-3-XFM.

EntityCode.description: An entity code is a 2 to 6 character string comprised of upper-case letters and numbers (no hyphens). Each entity registers an entity code. Code should be chosen such that it is most recognizable. It is recommend that the entity code is either a truncated entity name or a stock ticker symbol.

ProductTypeIdentifier.description: Identifier used to identify a Product Type

CalibrationMethod.description: Description of calibration method for an instrument.

StartTime.description: The start time for a measurement period.

EndTime.description: The end time for a measurement period.

AccuracyClass.description: Accuracy class of an instrument. The string should identify the standard where applicable, or a term in common use by calibration laboratories. For example, for a pyranometer, accuracy class can be "Secondary Standard". For an AC power meter, accuracy class could be "ANSI C12.20-2015 Class 0.5".

CalibrationInterval.description: The recommended time interval between calibrations.

IrradianceDirectNormal.description: The amount of direct irradiance received per unit area on a surface that is perpendicular (or normal) to the direction of the sun. Direct irradiance, also termed beam irradiance, is not scattered or reflected by the atmosphere, clouds, or other surfaces before arriving at the surface of measurement. Direct normal irradiance is measured in watts per square meter.

IrradianceDiffuseHorizontal.description: The amount of diffuse radiation received per unit area on a horizontal surface. Diffuse irradiance arrives at the surface of measurement from any direction other than the direction of the sun. Diffuse horizontal irradiance is measured in watts per square meter.

IrradiancePlaneOfArray.description: The irradiance on a plane from all sources, both direct and diffuse. The plane can be horizontal or tilted. Plane of array irradiance is measured in watts per square meter.

IrradianceGlobalHorizontal.description: Total amount of shortwave radiation received per unit area on a horizontal surface. Measured in watts per square meter.

WindSpeed.description: Velocity of the wind, typically measured at 3m height above ground.

WindDirection.description: Azimuth direction from which the wind is blowing.

HumidityRelative.description: Ratio between the amount of moisture in the air and the maximum amount of moisture that could be present in the air at current air temperature.

PressureAtmospheric.description: The air pressure at the location of the weather data record

Rainfall.description: Amount of rainfall in a given period of time

Snowfall.description: Amount of snowfall in a given period of time

PrecipitationType.description: Type of precipitation according to SYNOP codes

Albedo.description: Percentage of light that is reflected off the ground surface

SnowAccumulation.description: Depth of snow on the ground during a given period of time

CurrentShortCircuit.description: Current of a photovoltaic device at short circuit conditions.

VoltageOpenCircuit.description: Voltage of a photovoltaic device at open circuit conditions.

CurrentMaximumPower.description: Current of a photovoltaic device at the maximum power point.

VoltageMaximumPower.description: Voltage of a photovoltaic device at the maximum power point.

RevenueGrade.description: True if power meter is revenue grade quality.

MeasurementScope.description: Scope of the power measurement. Can be "System" for the entire PV system, "Inverter XXX" for a specific inveter, "String YYY" for a specific string.

PowerAC.description: Power (AC) measured at an instant in time

PowerDC.description: Power (DC) measured at an instant in time

EnergyAC.description: Energy (AC) measured for a period of time.

TemperatureMeter.description: Temperature of a power measurement device.

TemperatureModule.description: Temperature measured at the back of a module.

TemperatureCell.description: Temperature of a cell in a module.

CurtailmentLimit.description: Curtailment limit on AC power during a period of time.

Availability.description: Percent of AC capacity available during a period of time.

Soiling Ratio.description: Soiling ratio in percent. The soiling ratio is the ratio of irradiance reaching a soiled module's cells, to the irradiance reaching the cells of a clean module.

ReferenceCellCalibrationConstantAtReport.description: Ratio of reference cell current to irradiance at spectrum for reporting condition, termed C_RC in ASTM E2848-11. Units of A/(W/m2).

DataSelected.description: Indicates data inclusion or exclusion. True if data is retained; False if data is excluded.

DataFilterVisual.description: Indicator that data pass checks by visual examination.

DataFilterOutliers.description: Indicator that data passes tests for outlier values.

DataFilterMissing.description: Indicator that data passes tests that detect missing values.

DataFilterCollectionSystem.description: Indicator that data passes checks for data collection system faults or outages.

DataFilterOutsideRange.description: Indicator that data passes checks for values outside of acceptable range.

DataFilterStability.description: Indicator that data values pass checks for unstable values, e.g., where data values change more than a threshold in a time interval.

DataFilterInverterClipping.description: Indicator that data passes checks for periods of inverter clipping or operating away from maximum power point tracking.

DataFilterShading.description: Indicator that data passes checks for periods of time where the irradiance instrument or PV system is shaded by nearby structures, soiling, snow, frost or other cause.

DataFilterInstrumentAlignment.description: Indicator that data passes checks for alignment between an irradiance instrument and a PV system's plane of array.

FilterTemperatureAmbientMaximum.description: Upper limit on ambient air temperature.

FilterTemperatureAmbientMinimum.description: Upper limit on ambient air temperature.

FilterIrradianceStabilityMaximum.description: Maximum coefficient of variation (ratio of standard deviation to mean) of irradiance during a window of data.

FilterIrradianceStabilityWindowLength.description: Duration of a window for determining irradiance stability.

ASTME28484ModelCoefficientA1.description: Coefficient a1 in Equation 1 of ASTM E2848-11, P = E(a1 + a2 x E + a3 x Ta + a4 x V) where P is power, E is in-plane irradiance, Ta is ambient air temperature and V is wind speed.

ASTME28484ModelCoefficientA2.description: Coefficient a2 in Equation 1 of ASTM E2848-11, P = E(a1 + a2 x E + a3 x Ta + a4 x V) where P is power, E is in-plane irradiance, Ta is ambient air temperature and V is wind speed.

ASTME28484ModelCoefficientA3.description: Coefficient a3 in Equation 1 of ASTM E2848-11, P = E(a1 + a2 x E + a3 x Ta + a4 x V) where P is power, E is in-plane irradiance, Ta is ambient air temperature and V is wind speed.

ASTME28484ModelCoefficientA4.description: Coefficient a4 in Equation 1 of ASTM E2848-11, P = E(a1 + a2 x E + a3 x Ta + a4 x V) where P is power, E is in-plane irradiance, Ta is ambient air temperature and V is wind speed.

ASTME2848PowerRatingAtReportingCondition.description: Power rating P0 at reporting condition calculated using fitted model. Calculated by Equation 2 of ASTM E2848-11, P0 = E(a1 + a2 x E + a3 x Ta + a4 x V) where E is in-plane irradiance, Ta is ambient air temperature and V is wind speed at the reporting condition.

ASTME2848PowerRatingUncertainty.description: Expanded uncertainty of the power rating at the reference condition. See ASTM E2848-11 paragraph 9.4 for guidance on calculating the expanded uncertainty.

ASTME2848ModelResidualMean.description: Mean value of the residuals of the regression model at ASTM E2848-11 Eq. 1.

ASTME2848ModelResidualStandardDeviation.description: Standard deviation of the residuals of the regression model at ASTM E2848-11 Eq. 1.
